title: Junior Product Developer Regional Relevance - H&M Womenswear
description:
**Job Description**

*Are you passionate about fashion, trends, and driven by the idea of creating a relevant and inspiring assortment that meets the needs of customers across different regions?*




*We’re now looking for a curious and motivated Junior Product Developer to join our Regional Relevance team at H&M Womenswear. If you thrive in a fast paced and creative environment and want to grow your skills in product development, this is your opportunity to make an impact and help shape a global assortment that feels locally meaningful.*




*This position is a 1 year temporary role based at our HQ in Stockholm, Sweden.*




**WHAT YOU’LL DO** 
**​**
  

 As a Junior Product Developer in the Regional Relevance team, you will have an important role in the exciting and complex process of developing products for our collections that are sold in all our sales markets around the world.
   

  





 Together with a close and collaborative team, you work on identifying and developing the right assortment for specific regions based on current and upcoming trends, local needs, and commercial insights. Your main responsibility will be to support the Product Developer in creating a relevant offer for our customers, always guided by our strategy and target.
   

  





 You will collaborate cross functionally with a Product Manager, Designers, Planners and other key functions throughout the development process. You will be an important link between teams, driving the process forward and contributing to smooth coordination from idea to final product.
   

  





 As a Junior Product Developer, you will be part of our daily operational work, with several ongoing tasks. You will be involved in everything from handling samples to supporting the development of collections that meet customer demand and strengthen our regional relevance.
   

  





  

  





**WHO YOU ARE** 
**​**
  

 We are looking for people with…​
   

  




* At least one year of experience in product development or buying in fashion
* Relevant education in Textiles, Buying, or Product Development
* A commercial mindset with a strong drive to contribute to business growth
* A deep understanding of the womenswear customer and a sharp eye for fashion and trends
* A structured and organized way of working, with the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously
* A collaborative and communicative team player who thrives in a cross-functional environment with a humble and hands-on approach
* A curious mindset and eagerness to continuously learn and develop
* Strong commercial thinking, with the ability to spot opportunities for growth and profitability
* A passion for finding smarter ways of working and driving improvements in everyday tasks



  

  





**WHO WE ARE** 
**​**
  

 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.​
   

  





 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. ​
   

  





  

  





**JOIN US** 

  

 Additional information:
   

  

 This is a
 **1 year temporary position, with placement in Stockholm.** 
 If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please send your application including
 **CV in English** 
 as soon as possible. Interviews will be held continuously. (For internal candidates, please initiate a dialogue with you manager before applying.)  If you are currently in a permanent employment with H&M you will keep your permanent employment even if you take on a temporary position for a limited time.
   

  





 Benefits:
   

  

 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP.
   

  





 Inclusion & Diversity:
   

  

 H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.
   

  





 We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.
   

  





  

  





**Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.**

title: Full-Stack Developer to Process & Quality | SEB, Solna
description:
Join SEB’s journey to become a data-driven bank!
   

  

 Are you ambitious, creative, and eager to grow your skills with modern technologies? SEB’s IT Asset Management team is looking for a Full-Stack Developer to help us shape the future of our applications and deliver innovative and data driven solutions.
   

  

**About Us**
 We are a dynamic, growing team that values open collaboration, continuous learning, and shared responsibility. Our culture encourages knowledge sharing through pair programming, problem-solving workshops, and ‘Demo Fridays’. You’ll work alongside both junior and senior developers, with plenty of opportunities to learn and make an impact.
   

  

**About The Role**
 You will be part of an Agile delivery team, contributing throughout the entire lifecycle—from design to production support. You will be developing line-of-business applications with a strong focus on IT Asset management, playing a key role in delivering solutions in close collaboration with stakeholders and cross-functional teams.
   

  

 As the delivery area continues to grow, you’ll have the opportunity to work across the full stack—from database modelling and back-end development to APIs, user interfaces, and integrations with other critical systems within the bank.
   

  

**Tech Stack**
* .NET, C#
* Angular, TypeScript, HTML/CSS
* REST APIs
* GitHub, CI/CD
* SQL Server
* Visual Studio Professional
* Kubernetes
* GitHub Copilot


**We Believe You Have**
* 3+ years of experience with .NET
* Frontend development experience and are familiar with Angular
* SQL Server and API development skills
* Experience with GitHub, CI/CD, and Kubernetes
* A proactive mindset and strong ownership of delivery
* A collaborative spirit and eagerness to share knowledge
* Comfort working in Agile and DevOps environments
* English fluency
* It is meritorious if you have experience with Google Cloud Platform


**Do you want to be a part of SEB?**
 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than January 25th, 2026. Due to Christmas Holidays we initiate selection process in full during the middle of January. If you have questions about the position, please contact Mikaela Sterner, Team Manager, mikaela.sterner@seb.se.
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB here: http://www.sebgroup.com/techcareers
   

  

*SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.*
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Full-stack developer
description:
We are looking for more Fullstack Developers to join the Digital & IT team in Stockholm!
   

  

**About This Vacancy**
 At TMC, you will work closely with our clients in Greater Stockholm on projects spanning the entire development chain, from backend and database layers to modern frontend frameworks. The role involves responsibility for developing robust solutions, optimizing code, building integrations, and contributing to scalable systems in cloud environments. You will work in a dynamic environment with close collaboration between various teams, providing opportunities to enhance both technical and communication skills. As an Employeneur at TMC, you’ll take on assignments where your expertise makes a difference. At the same time, you will be part of our Digital & IT business cell in Stockholm, where we are building a strong network of developers and specialists.
   

  

**What We Expect From You**
 We believe that you have:
   

  

* Higher education or university degree in a relevant field (At least BSc, MSc is an advantage)
* At least five years of experience in software development
* Familiarity with working on cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure)
* Experience with CI/CD, Docker, and Kubernetes
* Understanding of microservices
* We assume that you are fluent in both Swedish and English.


 An advantage would be if you have a background in IT security, DevOps, IaC, cybersecurity, AI/ML, or data engineering.
   

  

**What You Can Expect From Us**
 In the role of Employeneur, you get to both develop your technical expertise and drive your own growth and business. You become part of an innovative and entrepreneurial organization where the focus is on continuous development and the ability to take responsibility for steering your own career. We place great emphasis on your personal commitment and your willingness to advance your development. To succeed in this, you are given the opportunity to influence the type of projects you take on as well as the professional development you want to invest in. In short, you are in charge of your career. Since TMC is an international company, we can offer projects in various locations across the countries where we and our clients are present. Currently, we are represented in Sweden, the Netherlands, Belgium, France, Germany, Luxembourg, Spain, Portugal, Italy, Hungary, UAE, Mexico, the USA, and Canada. You’ll have the world as your workplace!

title: Senior Software Developer (Java)
description:
**Role Overview**
**Do you want to shape how AI systems are built, not just how they are used?**
 We are looking for a Senior Backend Developer (Java) to take a leading role in building the technical foundations that enable AI agents to operate across Tradedoubler. This is a highly autonomous role focused on designing the platforms, execution environments, and architectural building blocks that allow intelligent systems to be safe, scalable, and increasingly autonomous.
   

  

 Rather than working from tightly scoped tickets, you will operate as a technical and systems thinker, identifying what capabilities need to exist for AI agents to work effectively in real-world systems. Your work will enable many different teams across the business to build AI solutions on top of shared, well-designed foundations.
   

  

 Working within the AI Centre of Excellence, you will help turn ambitious AI ideas into robust, production-ready systems. This role sits at the intersection of backend engineering, data, and AI-enabled platforms, and offers the opportunity to influence how Tradedoubler evolves into an AI-first organisation.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities**
* Design and build core backend platforms that enable AI agents to interact safely and effectively with data, services, and business systems.
* Define and implement foundational capabilities that support advanced agent behaviour, such as planning, experimentation, validation, and controlled execution.
* Create systems that allow AI agents to reason about complex tasks, manage context over time, and operate beyond simple request–response interactions.
* Build mechanisms that support safe iteration and learning, allowing agents to test actions and outcomes before making impactful changes.
* Work closely with AI engineers, data engineers, and domain experts to translate real business needs into general-purpose, reusable platform capabilities.
* Balance big-picture architectural thinking with hands-on implementation, ensuring ideas become reliable, scalable systems.
* Continuously explore and apply emerging patterns in AI-enabled systems, keeping Tradedoubler at the forefront of practical AI adoption.


**Your profile**
**How You’ll Be Successful In This Role**
* You are trusted to define problems as well as solve them.
* You think in terms of systems, constraints, and long-term evolution, not just individual features.
* You are comfortable navigating ambiguity and turning it into clear, pragmatic technical solutions.
* You enjoy enabling others — building platforms and abstractions that multiply the impact of teams across an organisation


**Professional** 
**requirements**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field.
* 4–8 years of professional experience developing backend systems in Java.
* Strong experience designing and building distributed, scalable, and high-throughput systems.
* Solid understanding of data structures, algorithms, and system design, and how to apply them pragmatically.
* Experience running and operating software in Linux environments.
* Strong focus on code quality, maintainability, and automated testing.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.


**It’s beneficial if you have experience with**
* High-transactional systems (e.g. finance, ad-tech, gaming, betting, or similar domains).
* Event-driven architectures, streaming platforms, or real-time data processing.
* APIs and service integration patterns used to connect multiple consumers (including AI agents) to shared data sources.
* Cloud platforms such as AWS or GCP.
* Containerization and orchestration, especially Docker and Kubernetes.
* Exposure to AI/ML platforms, LLM-based systems, or agent-based architectures (hands-on experience not required, but strong interest is important).
* Working closely with data teams (data engineers, ML engineers, analytics).


**Why us?**
**Why work at Tradedoubler?**
 Tradedoubler is an international performance marketing partner, creating smarter results for its clients and partners through traffic, technology and expertise. We help our clients grow their online sales and find new customers for their businesses and we help an expanding network of online publishers monetise their websites.
   

  

 Working at Tradedoubler is stimulating, challenging and fun. We pride ourselves in offering an environment where everyone can contribute and make a difference to the success of our business. Our employees come from all over the world, producing a culturally diverse environment where creativity, communication and idea sharing are highly valued.
   

  

 We recognise that our employees are the key to our success and with this in mind we offer competitive salaries and benefits as well as the opportunity for every employee to grow with us.
   

  

**About Us**
 Tradedoubler is a global partner marketing network that has been facilitating connections between result-driven brands and publishers worldwide for more than 25 years. We operate in 90+ markets across the globe and house over 2,000 brands and 180,000 publishers in our network. Our awesome teams are located across our 15 offices in Europe and Australia.
   

  

 In addition to Tradedoubler's core Partner Marketing business, we offer digital marketing solutions across the entire customer journey, including App marketing (Appiness), influencer marketing (Metapic), lead generation campaigns (Leadslab), & SaaS solutions (Grow by Tradedoubler).
   

  

 Tradedoubler was founded in 1999 in Stockholm, Sweden by Martin Lorentzon & Felix Hägnö, and has been listed on the Stockholm Stock Exchange since 2005.
   

  

 One of our strong beliefs at Tradedoubler is that our success stems from adhering to our core values: Make it Happen, Stay Curious, & Achieve Together.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**Senior-/Lead Engineer | Permanent | Hybrid | Stockholm** 




  





 For our client, a SaaS company from Stockholm, we are currently looking for a Senior-/Lead Engineer who can lead technically and be a role model to other Engineers.
 



  





 Do you love building well tested and stable applications?
 



 Do you believe that “teamwork makes the dream work”?
 



 As a Developer you can lead the charge and are no stranger to helping others around you?
 



  





 Then this opportunity might be for you!
 



  





**Your Impact** 




 You will be working tightly with both frontend and backend developers on the API and core functionalities, as well as building out the backbone of the platform, which is written in Ruby on Rails. You will challenge the current architecture, deploy improvements it and to the overall processes and systems. You will help coach the development team on best practices and help them grow along with the company. The goal is to have a well-tested and well-architected platform to build on for years to come and this role will have a large impact on how they can best accomplish this.
 



  




* **Lead with Innovation:** 
 Design, develop, and implement improvements that will be the foundation of the platform for years to come.
* **Mentor and Inspire:** 
 Guide and coach fellow developers, sharing your expertise to elevate the entire team’s skills and best practices.
* **Drive Quality:** 
 Ensure that the platform is not only well-tested and stable but also ready to support ambitious growth plans.



  





 Your contributions will have a lasting impact on the platform’s success, helping them to deliver world-class solutions to their clients.
 



  





**What you need** 



* +5 yrs of exp. in Node.JS & TypeScript
* Exp. maintaining and improving upon large code bases
* Exp. working with / writing test suites
* Experience with Postgres and optimizing it



  





**Nice-to-haves** 



* Ruby (On Rails) is a plus
* GraphQL is a plus
* AWS is a plus
* React is a plus



  





**What they offer** 



* A fast-growing startup culture on an ambitious mission to digitalize businesses world-wide
* A diverse team of talented and supportive colleagues
* Competitive compensation package
* Centrally located office in Stockholm
* Six weeks of paid vacation
* Pension at ITP1 levels
* Generous wellness grant and weekly training sessions with personal trainer
* Private healthcare insurance
* Chose you own machine!



  





**Ready to Make an Impact? Apply Now!** 




 We’re conducting interviews on a rolling basis, so don’t wait to apply.

title: Backend Engineer
description:
Intric is accelerating its growth, driven by a fresh round of funding from investors and strong demand from both existing and new customers.
   

  

 Our platform - Intric.ai - is currently transforming how work is done, primarily within the public sector and companies that value data sovereignty, by making the power of AI accessible to a wider audience. We have secured a market-leading position in a niche of this segment.
   

  

 We are seeking a motivated individual eager to embark on the journey of a lifetime with our expanding and driven team.
   

  

**Your role**
 As a Backend Engineer, you will be working on the product, from building new features to improving the infrastructure.
   

  

****Key Responsibilities****
 You will be instrumental in ensuring that we build the best possible product in the shortest amount of time, without compromising on scalability or robustness. This includes:
   

  

* Building new features.
* Improving the developer experience.
* Improving the infrastructure.


**Ideal Candidate Profile**
**Core qualities**
* Intelligent and execution-focused, with a knack for delivering results.
* Independent thinker who can identify optimal solutions for integration challenges.
* Driven by challenges and adept at overcoming technical hurdles.


**Cultural attributes**
* Committed to our long-term vision and willing to grow with the organization.
* Passionate about building extraordinary solutions from the ground up.
* Collaborative team player who excels in competitive environments.


**Qualifications**
* BSc or MSc in Computer Science or related field.
* 2+ years of professional experience.
* Demonstrated interest and enthusiasm for artificial intelligence technologies.
* Evidence of completed projects demonstrating technical expertise.
* Examples of overcoming specific technical challenges with tangible solutions.
* A track record that showcases initiative and contributions beyond typical job requirements.


**What We Offer**
* Be a part of a visionary and driven team establishing the future of AI in Europe.
* Work in a stimulating environment with opportunities for professional growth.
* Rapid career development in an exciting, fast-moving sector.
* Competitive compensation package combining salary and stock options.


**Our tech-stack**
**Backend App**
 Python, FastAPI
   

  

**Infrastructure**
 Docker, PostgreSQL, Redis, pgvector, Arq, vLLM, Kubernetes
   

  

**Other Important Tools / Techniques**
 Linux, Bash, Domain Driven Design

title: Full-Stack .NET Developer
description:
**Är du en passionerad .NET utvecklare som söker nya möjligheter?**
 If är det ledande försäkringsbolaget i Norden. IT är en central del av vår verksamhet och vi arbetar intensivt med att vidareutveckla våra system för att möta våra kunder i den digitala världen. Våra stora strategiska projekt är baserade på .NET-plattformen. Användarupplevelse och kvalitet är viktiga drivkrafter för att våra kunder ska uppleva att ”If hjälper mycket”.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Hos oss får du utveckla våra viktigaste IT-system där din kunskapsnivå och ditt intresse kommer att styra ansvarsområden och utvecklingsvägar. Du kommer att ingå i ett team som är en central del av vår nyutveckling och samtidigt arbetar med aktiv förvaltning av befintliga lösningar. Det är en Microsoftbaserad applikation med omkring 2500 användare i Sverige och Norge som bland annat hanterar våra kunder, produkter och försäkringsengagemang.
   

  

 Vi arbetar både med desktop-applikationer och webb. Tekniken är i huvudsak .NET/C#, SQL Server och en servicebaserad arkitektur (WCF och WebAPI). Annan teknik vi använder ASP.NET, Javascript/React och Cloud/Azure. Du har din tyngdpunkt inom den senaste tekniken vilket gör dig till en nyckelspelare i teamet när vi kontinuerligt moderniserar systemen.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
* En inkluderande arbetsmiljö där alla är välkomna
* Karriär- och utvecklingsmöjligheter i det största försäkringsbolaget i Norden
* Möjlighet till en hybrid arbetsplats
* Sociala aktiviteter
* Lunchförmån
* En hälsofrämjande arbetsplats som exempelvis erbjuder friskvårdsbidrag
* Rabatt på försäkringar tecknade hos If skadeförsäkringar
* Hög pensionsavsättning


**Om teamet**
 Teamet består av 14 medlemmar. Det inkluderar roller såsom utvecklare, produktägare, scrum master, QA, arkitektur och support. Huvuddelen av utvecklarna har lång erfarenhet av både tekniken och domänen. Vi arbetar enligt agila principer och alla hjälper varandra att lyckas.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som är en ambitiös utvecklare med minst fem års erfarenhet av moderna lösningar inom .NET och en akademisk utbildning inom IT. Du trivs med att arbeta i grupp och har erfarenhet av att arbeta enligt agila principer. Viktiga egenskaper är att du är positiv, drivande i ditt sätt att arbeta och vill dela med dig av din kunskap. Du är nyfiken, ser möjligheter och gillar att delta i och påverka förändring. Du kommunicerar obehindrat med kollegor på svenska och även på engelska.
   

  

**Mer information och rekryteringsprocessen**
**Sista ansökningsdag:** 
 31 Januari 2026. För att ansöka vill vi att du bifogar ett CV och besvarar några frågor i vårt rekryteringssystem.
   

  

**Ort:** 
 Stockholm, Bergshamra.
   

  

**Start:** 
 Enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Slutkandidater kommer genomgå en bakgrundskontroll innan en anställning kan bli aktuell.

title: Software Engineer - Front-end till Axfood IT, Stockholm
description:
Välkommen till Axfood IT, en av matbranschens största IT-avdelningar med ca 400 medarbetare. Det är vi som ser till att Axfood, och alla våra kedjor, kan ligga i framkant vad gäller digital utveckling. Vi jobbar med att utveckla och förbättra allt ifrån e-handel till logistiklösningar och AI.
   

  

 Hos Axfood IT blir du del av ett sammanhang som utmanar och levererar lösningar som gör skillnad, både för våra kollegor och våra kunder. Här finns det alltid möjlighet att lära sig om ny teknik och växa, både som individ och tillsammans med kollegorna.
   

  

**Ditt nya team**
 Hämta kassarna i ett skåp, eller få maten hemkörd till dörren? I vårt e-handelsteam utvecklar vi digitala tjänster som gör det enklare och härligare för våra kunder att handla mat online, oavsett om det är via mobilen eller webben.
   

  

 I gruppen finns specialister inom bland annat test, design, agila metoder och såklart webb- och apputveckling, som jobbar tillsammans för att skapa de bästa lösningarna för hundratusentals kunder varje vecka. Vi arbetar med ett starkt fokus på användarupplevelse och tillgänglighet. Hos oss jobbar vi i AWS, Java, React,js och React Native för våra e-handelslösningar i webb och app.
   

  

**Ett ax-plock - Kollegornas favoriter på jobbet**
* Chansen att delta i projekt som sträcker sig över hela Axfood-koncernen
* Att jobba med produkter och lösningar som gör skillnad i människors vardag, i hela landet.
* Ett team med stark teknisk kompetens som har kul tillsammans


**Om rollen**
 I den här rollen kommer du framför allt att arbeta och driva vår apputveckling i React Native och skapa framtidens e-handelsuppelevlser. Som senior utvecklare ser vi också att du i den här rollen tar ett naturligt ledarskap i teamet genom att coacha kollegor, driva tekniska beslut och bidra till ett hållbart och effektivt arbetssätt.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer att inkludera:**
* Designa, utveckla, testa och optimera stabila, skalbara och säkra e-handelslösningar, huvudsakligen i React Native
* Arbeta effektivt med arkitekter, UX-designers, och produktteam för att nå gemensamma mål
* Skriva automatiserade tester
* Delta i planering, prioritering och kontinuerlig förbättring av teamets arbetssätt
* Förstå och tillämpa verksamhetskunskap för att säkerställa att tekniska lösningar möter affärsbehoven och bidrar till organisationens övergripande mål


**Stämmer detta in på dig?**
 Vi söker dig som är en erfaren frontendutvecklare med passion för teknik och människor. Som person tror vi att du är nyfiken på ny teknik och gillar att hitta och driva nya lösningar. Du är prestigelös, kommunikativ och bidrar till en positiv kultur när du samarbetar inom det egna teamet, och med andra.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du:**
* Har god erfarenhet av apputveckling i React Native
* Är van att skriva automatiserade tester
* Trivs i en agil miljö med högt tempo och stort ansvar.


 Det är extra meriterande om du också har erfarenhet av e-handel eller en annan frontendmiljö med hög komplexitet och stor mängd funktionalitet. Kan du också lite webbutveckling är det ett plus.
   

  

**Ansökningsprocessen**
 Vi vill att det ska vara enkelt att söka jobb hos oss. Om du inte har ett CV redo räcker det med att du länkar en väl ifylld LinkedIn-profil. I din ansökan får du svara på de frågor vi behöver svar på i den här delen av processen, och personligt brev är därför inte obligatoriskt.
   

  

 Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan därför tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Vår rekryteringsprocess innehåller tester, intervjuer, bakgrundskontroll och ID-kontroll. Observera att vi inte under denna rekryteringsprocess kommer be dig logga in med ditt Bank-id eller scanna någon QR-kod, men vi kommer be dig styrka din identitet i processens slutskede.
   

  

 Vid frågor om rekrytering på Axfood, kontakta Medarbetarsupporten på jobb@axfood.se. Läs mer: Så går det till när du söker jobb inom Axfood. Om du har frågor om tjänsten, kontakta elisabeth.wehlin@axfood.se. Av GDPR-skäl behandlar vi inga ansökningar eller annan personlig information via mail.
   

  

 Lyssna på en pod om att jobba på Axfood IT, på Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/episode/37BDOFjcKLkdyleKXLEKXZ?si=UVhPBFC4T96dy-tHa9uuDw

title: Pega developer (banking)
description:
At Capgemini, you’ll have the opportunity to shape your career in a way that suits you, supported by a global community of experts who inspire and empower you. We believe in reimagining what’s possible - using technology to build a more sustainable, inclusive world. Our Financial Services team is at the forefront of this mission. As a reliable partner we guide our customers such as major banks and insurance companies with everything from strategy and planning to implementation and management.
   

  

**Your role**
 Working with experienced colleagues, you will assist our customers from early-stage advice to the implementation and integration of the multifaceted platform Pega. Depending on your experience and background, you will have various opportunities and roles in Pega projects. Our projects enhance customer experiences, create customer journeys, and bring them to life with agile teams. We establish new digital platforms and streamline work processes with digital solutions.
   

  

*In this position you will play a key role in:*
* Designing and developing Pega applications to automate banking processes.
* Translating business requirements into effective Pega solutions.
* Customizing and configuring Pega systems to meet specific project needs.
* Providing ongoing maintenance and support for existing Pega applications.


**Your profile**
* Experience from Pega, either from a position as a developer or system architect.
* Experience in working in an agile and test-driven environment.
* Previous consulting or client service delivery experience.
* One or more certifications in SA, SSA or LSA.
* Proficiency in Swedish is a plus and candidates based in Sweden will be prioritized.
* Experience in financial services or the insurance industry is beneficial.


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* You get to work with major customers within banking and insurance, in exciting and varied roles, giving you the opportunity to develop both personally and professionally.
* The freedom to make decisions, manage your time, and work independently - fostering creativity, innovation, and job satisfaction.
* An extensive benefits package, including parental benefits, occupational and flex pension, private insurance, preventive healthcare, and more.
* A variety of social and wellness activities, from sports and health programs to cultural events and art initiatives, designed to bring employees together and enrich work life.


*As part of our recruitment process, identity verification and background checks may occasionally be conducted. More information will be provided if applicable.*
*We’re in the midst of the holiday season and we hope you’re having a pleasant end of the year! We’ll start reviewing applications during January and look forward to possibly connecting with you soon!*
**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is an AI-powered global business and technology transformation partner, delivering tangible business value. We imagine the future of organizations and make it real with AI, technology and people. With our strong heritage of nearly 60 years, we are a responsible and diverse group of 420,000 team members in more than 50 countries. We deliver end-to-end services and solutions with our deep industry expertise and strong partner ecosystem, leveraging our capabilities across strategy, technology, design, engineering and business operations. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

**Make it real |** 
**www.capgemini.com**

title: Senior Fullstack Developer | Saab
description:
**Välkommen till Product Tech!** 




*Product Tech är platsen där Saabs framtida teknik formas. Som en central del av* 
***Common Tech***
*har Product Tech uppdraget att bygga de gemensamma tekniska lösningar som kommer att användas i Saabs produkter - idag och imorgon.* 




  





*Här arbetar du med att utveckla och vidareutveckla plattformar, komponenter och tekniska förmågor som ligger till grund för nästa generations system. Ett särskilt fokus ligger på* 
***AI-baserade lösningar***
*som kommer att integreras i Saabs produktportfölj och användas brett över organisationen. Det du är med och skapar i Product Tech får direkt genomslag i flera produkter, team och affärsområden.* 




*I Product Tech kombineras djup teknisk kompetens med ett långsiktigt perspektiv. Arbetet handlar inte om enskilda projekt, utan om att bygga stabila, återanvändbara och framtidssäkra lösningar som andra team kan lita på. Här får du möjlighet att påverka arkitektur, tekniska val och riktning - i en miljö där kvalitet, samarbete och tekniskt ledarskap står i centrum.* 




  





*Vill du arbeta nära framtidens AI-lösningar och vara med och skapa den tekniska grunden för Saabs produkter, är Product Tech rätt plats för dig.* 




  





**Älskar du att röra dig mellan olika tekniska miljöer och hålla ihop helheten i komplexa system? Trivs du med att kombinera kodhantverk, arkitektur och många kontaktytor? Vill du vara en bärande del i utvecklingen av Saabs gemensamma mjukvaruplattform? Då kan det här vara rollen för dig!** 




  





**Din roll** 




 Som senior fullstack-utvecklare blir du en av de personer som håller ihop plattformen och säkerställer att den utvecklas i rätt riktning. Du arbetar både applikationsnära och backend nära och växlar mellan olika språk, miljöer och nivåer av stacken beroende på vad uppgiften kräver.
 



 En central del av rollen är att vara nära organisationen. Du har många dialoger med produktägare, utvecklingsteam och tekniska specialister i olika delar av Saab för att förstå behov, fånga upp idéer och omsätta dem till tydliga tekniska lösningar. Du bidrar till att driva piloter, utforska nya arbetssätt och skapa struktur och riktlinjer i ett område som fortsätter att växa snabbt.
 



 Du utvecklar produktkod och fokuserar på att bygga stabila, hållbara och återanvändbara komponenter som flera produktteam använder i sina system. Du använder din tekniska bredd och din förmåga att se helheten för att få saker att hända och landa på rätt sätt i organisationen.
 



  





**Din profil** 




 Vi söker dig som trivs med att kombinera djupt kodande med att vara en sammanhållande kraft i ett större tekniskt ekosystem. Du är language agnostic och väljer verktyg efter problemet, inte tvärtom. Du uppskattar att vara med i en organisation som är i uppbyggnad, där du får påverka struktur, teknik och riktning när plattformen växer.
 



  





**För att lyckas i denna roll, bör du ha följande kvalifikationer:** 



* Flera års erfarenhet av fullstack-utveckling i moderna språk (t.ex. C#, C++, Python eller liknande)
* Erfarenhet av både backend och desktop-/applikationsutveckling
* Förståelse för arkitekturprinciper och återanvändbara plattformsdelar
* Förmåga att driva tekniska dialoger och skapa struktur över teamgränser
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i komplexa tekniska miljöer



  





**Meriterande:** 



* Erfarenhet av storskaliga eller komponentbaserade system
* Erfarenhet av att driva piloter eller tekniska initiativ i större organisationer



  





*Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.* 




  





**Vad du blir en del av** 




**Common Tech** 
 har i uppdrag att skapa gemensamma tekniska förutsättningar för hela Saab. Genom att utveckla och förvalta gemensamma plattformar, tekniska ramverk och arbetssätt möjliggör Common Tech ett effektivt, enhetligt och långsiktigt teknikutvecklingsarbete över hela organisationen. Målet är att ge Saabs team rätt tekniska grund för att kunna utveckla avancerade produkter med hög kvalitet, säkerhet och tillförlitlighet.
 



  





**Product Tech** 
 är en av flera avdelningar inom Common Tech och fokuserar på att ta fram och vidareutveckla tekniska lösningar som används i flera produkter och system. Här byggs återanvändbara komponenter, gemensam funktionalitet och tekniska lösningar som hjälper produktteamen att arbeta snabbare och mer strukturerat, samtidigt som höga krav på stabilitet och kvalitet upprätthålls.
 



  





**Saab** 
 är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med ett tydligt uppdrag: att bidra till att skydda människor och samhällen. Med omkring 20 000 medarbetare världen över utvecklar Saab avancerad teknik i nära samarbete mellan människor, kompetenser och discipliner. Företaget präglas av en inkluderande kultur där samarbete, lärande och långsiktig utveckling står i centrum.
 



  





 Dessa positioner kräver godkänd säkerhetsprövning enligt den svenska säkerhetsskyddslagen.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Den här rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Jeﬀerson Wells för SAABS räkning, vilket innebär att du kommer att bli anställd direkt av SAAB.
 



  






 Vi tar ej emot ansökningar via email pga GDPR.
 




  





**Urval och intervjuer sker löpande, med start i mitten av januari.** 
 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: ServiceNow Developer på B3 Now
description:
Är du en vass ServiceNow-utvecklare som vill vara med och forma framtiden i ett snabbväxande specialistbolag?
   

  

**B3 Now** 
 är en del av B3 Consulting Group och ett av koncernens nyare specialistbolag med fullt fokus på ServiceNow. Här arbetar du i en start-up-liknande miljö där energi, innovation och nyfikenhet präglar vardagen. Hos oss bygger du moderna applikationer, utvecklar smarta lösningar och skapar verkligt affärsvärde för våra kunder.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som
 **ServiceNow Developer** 
 hos B3 Now blir du en viktig del av ett team av erfarna ServiceNow-specialister. Du arbetar i projekt och uppdrag med hög påverkan hos både nationella och internationella kunder inom bl.a. tillverkning, retail, finans, energi, telekom och offentlig sektor.
   

  

 Du kommer att utveckla, konfigurera och förbättra lösningar på ServiceNow-plattformen. Rollen är teknisk och hands-on, med stort fokus på programmering, modern utveckling och kvalitetssäkring.
   

  

 Du kommer bland annat att:
   

  

* Utveckla lösningar i ServiceNow med moderna kodningsmetoder och enligt best practice.
* Arbeta med Flow Designer, IntegrationHub, Scripted REST APIs och andra automatiserings- och integrationskomponenter.
* Utveckla användargränssnitt, formulär och logik genom både low-code och custom code.
* Översätta funktionella krav till tekniska lösningar.
* Samarbeta nära kundens verksamhet för att skapa värdeskapande lösningar.
* Bidra med teknisk rådgivning i utvecklings- och arkitekturfrågor.


 Vi söker dig som är en utvecklarprofil med stark teknisk grund och intresse för både kod och affär.
   

  

**Vidare ser vi att du har följande kvalifikationer:**
* Relevant akademisk examen eller motsvarande.
* 3–5 års erfarenhet av ServiceNow-utveckling, inklusive hands-on programmering.
* Erfarenhet av JavaScript, REST, SOAP, Scripted REST APIs samt arbete med XML/JSON.
* Erfarenhet av ServiceNow-moduler och relevanta certifieringar (ex.CAD, CIS).
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska.
* En analytisk, kommunikativ och lösningsorienterad approach.
* Förmåga att arbeta strukturerat, tänka kreativt och hantera komplexa tekniska utmaningar.


**Vi erbjuder:**
* Attraktiv och flexibel lönemodell.
* Möjlighet att påverka dina arbetstider och arbetsplats.
* Utbildningar för din professionella utveckling.
* En stark wellness-satsning genom Team B3, som främjar både hälsa och arbetsglädje.
* Kollegor med höga ambitioner och olika bakgrunder – ett inkluderande och internationellt mindset.
* En utmanande roll med stora möjligheter att växa tekniskt och professionellt.
* En kultur där vi både levererar värde till våra kunder och har roligt tillsammans.
* Möjlighet att påverka, bidra och vara med och forma framtiden för B3 Now.


**Om B3**
 På B3 Now tror vi på att kombinera yrkesstolthet med glädje. Vi drivs av att göra skillnad – både för våra kunder och våra kollegor. Vi bygger en miljö där lärande, samarbete och utveckling står i centrum, och där du får utrymme att växa i den riktning du vill.
   

  

 Vi investerar i din kompetens genom utbildningar, mentorprogram och kontinuerlig coaching. Vi tror att när du utvecklas, utvecklas även vi.
   

  

 B3 Now är en del av B3 Consulting Group, ett av Sveriges snabbast växande konsultbolag. Med kontor i Sverige, Norge och Polen och internationella samarbeten hjälper vi organisationer att maximera värdet av ServiceNow genom smarta, skalbara och effektiva lösningar.
   

  

 Vi är över 1000 specialister globalt i koncernen – och växer snabbt. Hos oss får du både tryggheten av en stor aktör och närheten i ett mindre bolag där du har stort inflytande.
   

  

**Kontakt** 
 Är du redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär? Ansök nu! Har du frågor är du välkommen att kontakta Stefan Saarnak på +46 76 725 7059

title: Engineering Manager, EU
description:
Hi 👋 I’m Colin, Director of Engineering, Europe. How do you feel about engineers writing product specs, making product decisions, and not breaking down projects into individual tickets? If that sounds exciting (even if a bit scary), read on because I’m looking for an engineering manager to help us build a different type of engineering team and culture at Ashby.
   

  

 To start, why do we need to be different? Time and again, I have witnessed engineers knowing what needs to be done yet being unable to get things done because of “the process” or because “more data is needed.” Some of the most effective projects have been
 *skunkworks* 
 projects, where engineers have taken total ownership of a problem and driven it to completion. I want to normalize that at Ashby.
   

  

 When we think about how these processes came about, we realize they carry a
 *pessimistic* 
 mindset. They box people into smaller roles to minimize the chance of not meeting a certain standard. At Ashby. we’re building an environment that is
 *optimistic* 
 about what engineers can own and achieve and embraces the innovative engineers (and frankly, often stays out of their way).
   

  

 To accomplish this, our engineering leaders need to think deeply about individual performance, process, and culture - not running sprint planning or driving product and technical decisions. You’ll focus on building your team, their skills to thrive with the ownership they’re given, and an environment that empowers them to do their best work consistently, with little distraction. For junior EMs we try to stay within 6 direct reports. This enables them to spend time with our teams observing, correcting, praising, and, yes, coding. We like our managers to be hands-on while also making sure they’re not on the critical path.
   

  

 We’ve already gathered an experienced, talented, and collaborative team of 25+ engineers. You’ll help me manage the growing team of engineers in Europe.
   

  

 In Addition To Working With Engineers You’ll Also Get To Work On Projects Yourselves. Some Examples Of Work Our Engineering Leaders Have Done
   

  

* Provide feedback on product and technical specs to help engineers identify where to cut scope or improve quality. You don’t make the final decisions, but you’ll influence and coach ICs to reach the right ones.
* Grow engineers to the point where they can take large, loosely defined projects, and deliver them with little intervention. They still ask for help when needed - the difference is that they’re driving.
* Jump into our systems and code to debug a customer issue, ship a small bug fix, or improve our developer experience. Engineering leaders at Ashby are great engineers and enjoy keeping their skills up-to-date (while staying off the critical path).
* Improve how we generate and simulate data in demo accounts. It’s a project off the critical path, but it helps you keep up-to-date on our codebase while immensely impacting the business, from Engineering to QA to Sales.


 Why be a manager?
   

  

 I had two experiences early in my career that set me on my path. I had a great manager who asked tonnes of questions about the decisions I was making and coached me without me realizing it. And I had a
 *terrible* 
 manager - being told to work harder after a week of 3am finishes was not what I needed as a young engineer. The stark difference between these two experiences motivated me to become a manager: I wanted every engineer I worked with to have the support I had in the best case.
   

  

 Since then, as I’ve learned more, I’ve realized that I love the kind of problems I get to solve as a manager. Deeply complex problems with long-term impact both on the company and on people’s lives. One of my proudest achievements is creating a fully transparent pay system, and on the day it was revealed, everybody was happy with it. Nobody stormed out. By spending time thinking deeply about everybody’s pay and ensuring the mechanics of promotion were clear, I put the team in a place where they could see a peer was paid more than them, and it not be a problem.
   

  

 Despite all this, I love being technical. I sometimes indulge myself and spend a morning writing some code to improve tests or provide better abstractions. If I couldn’t be a manager, I’d be super happy to be an IC.
   

  

 I’m looking for someone who is passionate. Passionate about both management and being technical. Someone who spots a pattern amongst their team, figures out a better way for us to operate, and then builds the automation that powers it. I introduced a new process that enables engineers to merge 30% of PRs without a human review beforehand. I also built the automation that approves these PRs. I
 *also* 
 built that automation with abstractions that make it easy for the engineers to improve the automation themselves.
   

  

 It can be hard to find seasoned engineering leaders who haven’t succumbed to the status quo in some way or another. We're committed to giving all our people a total and utter lack of terrible managers, and that means we're willing to take a chance on someone early in their leadership journey who's courageous, principled, and has the drive to build themselves into a great leader who can say “Yah I know everyone is doing that, but we won't because...”
   

  

 Why You Should or Shouldn’t Apply
   

  

 Engineering Leadership Comes In Many Flavors, Not All Of Which Fit Our Model. I Thought I’d Outline Some Things I’m Looking For To Help You Decide If This Fits What You’re Looking For
   

  

* You love being technical and can hold in-depth conversations with direct reports from infra to backend to frontend.
* You enjoy management problems. We want people who get excited about driving people to be their best, giving difficult feedback, and building systems that make this easier
* You hold your team to a high standard and don’t shy away from getting into the details and giving feedback, even to the best folks on your team.
* You are an excellent and empathetic communicator. Facilitating change at both an individual and organization level requires understanding how to navigate the beliefs, opinions, and past experiences of engineers and figuring out how to both convince them of a new way of doing things while also leaving yourself open to feedback.
* You know what exceptional engineers look like. You’ve thought deeply about what makes them tick, how to recruit them, and how to grow folks into them. I want to see depth here, the industry often regurgitates a vanilla description, but the reality is more nuanced.
* You’re good at thinking about product, business, and maybe even design, but you’re not interested in calling the shots and are more interested in building a team that can make the best decisions without you.
* You thrive in high-trust, high-autonomy environments. We're a young startup where leaders wear multiple hats, and you'll build your own (high-speed) on-ramp through developing strong feedback loops.


**Put Another Way, You Shouldn’t Apply If**
* You don’t enjoy coding or don’t find time to stay up-to-date on technology.
* You’ve gotten into management because it was the only growth path available
* You want to make all the product decisions instead of empowering your team to make those calls.
* You're happy with a team of engineers that are predominantly early-career, mid-career, or don't thrive with ownership or autonomy. With enough guardrails, the team can get things done.
* A staff or principal engineer to you is someone who spends most of their time project managing or doing architecture reviews.
* You’re not optimistic or convinced that we can build a large engineering team that functions differently than the status quo. You think, at some size, common processes need to be implemented to ensure consistent product delivery (e.g., sprint planning, product managers writing in-depth specifications). You might not say it out loud, but you think, at some size, compromises have to be made for the sake of hiring numbers.


 What We’re Building
   

  

 Talent teams aspire to build a hiring process that identifies great candidates, moves them quickly through the interview process, and provides an excellent experience for the candidate. To accomplish this, recruiters perform thousands of daily tasks to coordinate and relay information between candidates, interviewers, and hiring managers. Teams struggle to keep up!
   

  

 Scheduling a final round is an excellent example of our customers' challenges. A recruiter needs to collect availability from the candidate, identify potential interviewers, perform “Calendar Tetris” to find who is available to interview the candidate, schedule on the earliest date possible, and perform any last-minute adjustments as availability changes. They must perform this while considering the interview load on each individual and whether interviewers need to be trained and shadowing others. 🥵
   

  

 Ashby provides talent teams with intelligent and powerful software that provides insights into where they’re failing and automates or simplifies many of the tasks they’re underwater with. We put a lot of effort into designing products that are approachable to beginners but mastered and extended by power users. In many ways, spreadsheets set the bar here.
   

  

 We have many customers, great revenue growth, years of runway, and amazing investors like YCombinator, Elad Gil, and Lachy Groom. I’ll share more once we meet.
   

  

 Engineering Culture
   

  

 Our engineering culture is motivated by Abhik and Benji’s (our co-founders) belief that a small talented team, given the right environment, can build high-quality software fast (and work regular hours!).
   

  

 Collaboration is Natural, Communication is Deliberate
   

  

 Our engineering team (and the team at large) consists of lifelong learners who are humble and kind (meet them here!). These attributes create an environment where collaboration happens naturally (we filter for it in interviews). We combine this with research, prototyping, and written proposals to see around corners and get feedback from the team across time zones. Focus time is something that we hold sacred, and, with thoughtful and deliberate communication, engineers can focus 36h out of a 40h work week (Abhik wrote about it here). Even managers can rely on getting consistent time (and support to make, if necessary) to focus and do creative work without the demand of constant meetings.
   

  

 Increase Leverage, not Team Size
   

  

 We Built Ashby With The Quality, Breadth, And Depth That Many Customers Would Expect From Much Larger Teams Over Larger Time Scales. We’ve Done This Through Investment In
   

  

* Great developer tooling. Our CI/CD takes ~10m, and we deploy at least 5x a day. Everyone on the team has contributed to developer experience 💪🏾
* Building blocks to create powerful and customizable products fast. At the core of Ashby is a set of common components (analytics modeling and query language, policy engine, workflow engine, design system) which we are constantly improving. Each improvement to a common component cascades throughout our app (short video on it here).


**And a Demo Of One Of These Building Blocks**
 Here’s an impromptu quote from Arjun in our company Slack of what it’s like to build a feature at Ashby:
   

  

 Give Engineers Ownership & Autonomy
   

  

 We, as engineers, find clever ways to solve problems, which amplifies when we deeply understand the problem. All of us in technical leadership did our best work as engineers when we had a deep understanding of the end-user and the business and ownership over the solution. Our engineering culture reflects this experience: engineers own projects end-to-end, from speaking with users to writing product specs to UX design. These are skills that we often don’t get to practice as engineers, and, as a manager at Ashby, you’ll provide mentorship and feedback to engineers to ensure they are successful when delivering projects.
   

  

 Put Effort into Diversity
   

  

 Diverse teams drive innovation and better outcomes. As the father of two young girls, I want to see them grow up in a world where all industries are open
 *and welcoming* 
 to everyone, regardless of race, gender, or preferences. Helping to build a more diverse team at Ashby is my way of contributing to this change.
   

  

 Today, 26% of engineers at Ashby are from underrepresented groups. It’s not great, and we are taking conscious steps to improve, like sourcing diverse candidates, providing generous paid family leave, no leetcode interviews, and more.
   

  

 Interview Process
   

  

 At Ashby, Our Team And Interview Process Want To Help You Show Your Best Self. We’ll Dive Into Past Projects And Simulate Working Together. Our Interview Process Is Six Interviews In The Following Order
   

  

* Intro Call (30m) - Discuss your application questions, align on the responsibilities of the role, and answer questions about Ashby.
* Past Experience Deep Dive (1h) - Discuss your past experience as an engineering leader.
* Technical Screen (1h) - Add a feature back to Ashby. You'll spend most of your time understanding a specific part of our codebase and write less than 15 lines of code.
* Coffee Chat with VP of Engineering (1h) - Spend time with our VP of Engineering and get to know each other.
* Meet the Team (2h) - At this point, the engineering leadership team is excited about you and you'll meet our CEO, Engineers, Product Managers, and some other folks on the team.


 I will be your main point of contact and prepare you for interviews. If we don’t give an offer, we’ll provide feedback!
   

  

 Technology Stack
   

  

 I’m sharing our tech stack with the caveat that we don’t require previous experience: TypeScript (frontend & backend), Node.js, React, Apollo GraphQL, Postgres, Redis.
   

  

**Benefits**
* Competitive salary and equity.
* 10-year exercise window for stock options. You shouldn’t feel pressure to purchase stock options if you leave Ashby —do it when you feel financially comfortable.
* Unlimited PTO with four weeks recommended per year. Expect “Vacation?” in our one-on-one agenda until you start taking it 😅.
* Generous equipment, software, and office furniture budget. Get what you need to be happy and productive!
* $100/month education budget with more expensive items (like conferences) covered with manager approval.


 Ashby’s success hinges on hiring great people and creating an environment where we can be happy, feel challenged, and do our best work. We’re being deliberate about building that environment from the ground up. I hope that excites you enough to apply.
   

  

*Ashby provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce and welcome people from all backgrounds, experiences, perspectives, and abilities.*

title: Software Engineer for QlikSense platform
description:
