title: PEGA-utvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Minst 4 års erfarenhet
* Flerårig erfarenhet som Pega-utvecklare
* Flerårig erfarenhet av API:er, integrationer och databaser
* Vana vid verktyg som GitLab, Azure DevOps, containers m.m.
* Erfarenhet av testmetodik och kvalitetssäkring


**Meriterande**
* Svenska i tal och skrift


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 19-01-2026
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.
   

  

 Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Staff Software Engineer (Flutter)
description:
**About us** 




 We are
 **B2B2C modular SaaS platform, powered by AI.** 
 Across ~40 different modules we are heavily relying on various integrations (payments, smart-locks, marketplaces) and AI (our in-house developed agentic-framework for our chatbot and advanced Insights). As the leading Tenant Experience platform in the Nordics, we reach more than 450,000 households - approximately 20% of all rental tenants in Sweden.
 



  





 Having proven product-market fit in the Nordics we are now embarking on an exciting growth journey and as we are evolving our Product & Technology organization we are looking for experienced
 **Flutter Engineer** 
 who wants to help bring our platform to the next level.
 



  





**Role Description** 




 As a
 **Staff Software Engineer (Flutter)** 
 at Avy, you will play a crucial role in leading and delivering engaging and high-performant frontends (mobile and web) for our end-users.
 



 Our teams work in a cross-functional, product-led, agile environment where tech, product and design collaborate closely.
 



  





 This role requires deep technical expertise and problem-solving mindset.
 



  





 In this role as our
 **Staff Software Engineer (Flutter)** 
 you would
 


* **Lead** 
 our Flutter Chapter
* Architect, Engineer and support implementation of Avy's front-ends
* Develop secure, clean and scalable code
* Make sure that written code is covered by tests with defined acceptance levels
* Work closely with design and product team in agile and scrum process
* Work closely with Product Owner in roadmap creation process
* Open to work in high paced, stable and agile start-up environment



  





 As this is Staff level role, you need to have at least several years of experience in Flutter development.
 



  





**Qualifications** 



* Proficient with AI-assisted tools in day-to-day work
* Previous experience in Flutter
* Previous experience with react-native or Android/iOS native development
* Material Design and Apple Human Interface Guidelines
* 5+ years experience with JavaScript or JAVA or Swift
* Experience consuming (non-)RESTful APIs
* Structured analytical mindset with strong communication skills
* **Experience leading teams**



  





**What we offer:** 



* Opportunity to shape the technical direction of a fast-growing prop-tech scale-up
* Collaborative and innovative work environment
* Competitive salary and benefits package
* Professional development opportunities
* Chance to work on cutting-edge technologies and solve complex problems



  





**Location (on-site):** 




 Stockholm, Sweden
 



  





*For this position, Avy is working with internal recruitment resources and is not accepting external agencies. Those kind of requests will not be answered.* 




  





*\*\*EU Candidates Only - No Relocation Provided at the moment\*\**

title: Embedded Software Engineer
description:
**Embedded Software Engineer – Wireless Access & IoT**
**Build the Future of Wireless Access with Us**
**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

 Hybrid │ Digital & Access Solutions EMEIA
   

  

 Embedded systems shape how people move, work and feel secure — and so will you.
   

  

 As an
 **Embedded Software Engineer** 
 in our Wireless Lock product unit, you help bring
 **APERIO®** 
 , our world-leading wireless access platform, to life. The firmware you build runs in real products used in hospitals, universities, workplaces and public buildings.
   

  

 If you want a role where technical depth meets purpose — and where secure, low-power, connected devices are your playground — this is where your impact becomes visible.
   

  

**Your Role**
 You’ll work hands-on with the firmware that powers our wireless locks and influence how they perform, connect and evolve.
   

  

**Design, Build, Deliver**
* Develop reliable, secure firmware for wireless, battery-powered locks
* Implement features on ARM Cortex MCUs (M0–M4) using C
* Debug at a low level using oscilloscopes, logic analysers and hardware tools


**Engineer for a Connected World**
* Work across RTOS and bare-metal environments
* Apply modern embedded practices, including CI/CD and automated testing
* Improve system performance, stability and long-term efficiency


**Advance Wireless Access Technology**
* Enhance connectivity features (BLE, Zigbee, NFC/ISO14443, UWB) and low-power performance
* Bring insights from IoT trends, cybersecurity and standards into development


**What You Bring**
* Strong skills in embedded C development on ARM Cortex MCUs
* Ability to debug deeply using hardware tools
* Experience with RTOS or bare-metal environments
* Familiarity with CI/CD and structured development practices
* Clear communication and a collaborative, solutions-focused mindset


**Nice to have / keen to develop:** 
 BLE/Zigbee, low-power design, credential technologies or IoT security trends.
   

  

**What You Gain By Joining Us**
**Work That Matters**
 Your firmware helps secure thousands of buildings worldwide and makes daily life safer and more accessible.
   

  

**Autonomy in Action**
 Your expertise is trusted. You’ll influence architecture, explore new ideas and shape how our wireless locks evolve.
   

  

**Growth with Purpose**
 Whether you want to deepen your embedded skills, explore wireless protocols or grow into technical leadership, we support your development.
   

  

**A Culture That Backs You**
 Our team works on site most of the time – and it’s one of our strengths. As an embedded engineer, being close to hardware, test rigs and your colleagues make a real difference. Working together accelerates debugging, shortens testing loops and gives you the fast problem-solving environment that embedded development benefits from. You feel the energy, the collaboration and the impact of your work every day.
   

  

**Ready to Build Technology That Protects the World?**
 If you want to grow within a team that values innovation, craftsmanship and the power of connected devices — we want to meet you.
   

  

**Apply today. Bring your expertise. Shape our future.**
 We review applications continuously, so don’t wait.
   

  

 We’re committed to building diverse, inclusive teams and encourage applications from all who see themselves thriving here.
   

  

 To make sure your personal data stays protected, we do not review applications sent via email or post.
   

  

 If you have questions about the role or process, contact Léa Rein, Senior Talent Acquisition Business Partner.
   

  

**Let’s create a safer and more open world — together.**
**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 63,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Chief Data Engineer
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

 Role Summary
   

  

 As Chief Data Engineer, you lead Scania’s Commercial Data Engineering team to build and operate reliable, secure, and cost-efficient data products and pipelines that power BI, analytics, and AI. You define engineering standards and reusable blueprints, deliver on AWS/Snowflake/dbt, and establish robust DataOps for lifecycle, observability, compliance, and SLAs.
   

  

 Job Responsibilities
   

  

 Lead and grow the Data Engineering team; define ways of working aligned to business needs and Data Mesh infrastructure
   

  

 Develop, publish, and maintain engineering standards and blueprints (coding/testing, dbt conventions, CI/CD, schema/versioning, observability)
   

  

 Deliver high-quality data products optimized for BI, AI and analytics
   

  

 Implement pipelines and controls for retention, PII handling, access frameworks, and auditability; automate policy enforcement
   

  

 Establish and operate DataOps tooling; enable self-service via platform templates
   

  

 Operate pipelines from ingestion to serving; implement runbooks, incident response, reliability patterns
   

  

 Own data product lifecycle; manage SLAs, cost-to-serve, capacity; align with governance and migration/decommission plans
   

  

 Monitor lineage, freshness, completeness, drift, health, cost, and usage; publish KPIs
   

  

 Run feedback loops with producers/consumers; drive continuous improvement
   

  

 Support domain teams building data products; coach on data quality rankings and SLOs
   

  

 Lead a Data Engineering Community of Practice
   

  

 Who You Are
   

  

 You are a hands-on technical leader who scales best practices through standards, automation, and mentorship. You care deeply about quality, reliability, and developer productivity.
   

  

 We are seeking candidates who are ambitious, self-driven, and supportive in their approach. You should be an excellent communicator and mentor, focused on outcomes and committed to continuous learning. A pragmatic, customer-first attitude and a collaborative spirit are essential qualities for this role.
   

  

**Useful Skills & Experiences**
 6+ years in data engineering with 3+ years leading data engineering teams
   

  

 Proven delivery of pipelines and data products on AWS, dbt, and Snowflake; knowledge of Azure.
   

  

 Advanced proficiency with dbt and modern ELT/ETL; strong in CI/CD
   

  

 Experience establishing Data Mesh and DataOps
   

  

 Strong stakeholder management and coaching
   

  

 Experience with external data sources as products is a plus
   

  

 Bachelor’s/Master’s in engineering or other relevant field
   

  

 Proficiency in English
   

  

 This Is Us
   

  

 We are part of Scania Commercial’s Digitalization & Processes organization, working closely with domain data owners, MDM, engineering, analytics/ML, and architecture teams. We value an inclusive, learning culture with hybrid work options (Södertälje base), flexible hours, wellness support, result bonus, and access to Scania Job Express buses for an easy commute. Your unique perspectives help shape sustainable mobility solutions.
   

  

 As a manager, I really believe in our core value respect for the individual, and want to support and help all employees reach their full potential, whoever they are.
   

  

 Scania Offers
   

  

 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

 Application
   

  

 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2026-01-28. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact: Martin Hargel, Data architect, martin.hargel@scania.com or Marie Hammar, Acting Head of Commercial AI & Data Foundation (hiring manager), marie.hammar@scania.com
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: Utvecklare med fokus på molntjänster till Sweco i Stockholm/Uppsala
description:
*Vill du koda något som gör skillnad på riktigt? Vi planerar och utvecklar samhällen så att de blir mer hållbara, bättre och smartare för både oss och kommande generationer. Vi jobbar i uppdrag med allt från rengöring av vatten, energiprojekt i Afrika, till att vi räddar liv genom att förebygga viltolyckor och bevarar biologisk mångfald. Nu söker vi dig som vill fortsätta utveckla framtidens samhällen med oss!* 
  

  

**Vilka är vi?**
 Vi är cirka 300 konsulter med teknisk kompetens och som brinner för innovativa lösningar. Vi är utvecklare, UX are, BIM are, data- och informationssamordnare, geodataexperter, GIS are, FME-experter, informationssäkerhetsspecialister, IT-projektledare och andra tekniska specialister. Tillsammans utgör vi Digital Services, som är en del utav Sweco med ett 50-tal kontor i hela Sverige. Vi har flera interna nätverk där vi delar erfarenheter och kompetens. Varje kontor har sin unika tillhörighet, med frukostar, aktiviteter, AW s och andra roliga saker för att lära känna varandra bättre och för att ha roligt tillsammans! I Stockholm är vårt kontor placerat med vacker utsikt över Kungsholmen och även i Uppsala sitter vi centralt placerat i en fin och härlig kontorsmiljö.
   

  

 Som företag satsar vi på ett ständigt lärande med bra kompetensutveckling och interna utvecklingsmöjligheter. Vi är en flexibel arbetsplats som värderar att må bra på jobbet med en sund balans mellan arbete och fritid. Som företag arbetar vi aktivt med hållbarhet, jämställdhet och mångfald. Det betyder bland annat att vi arbetar enligt FN s hållbarhetsmål, att vi finns med på den gröna listan över jämställda börsbolag och att vi rekryterar kompetensbaserat.
   

  

**Din framtida roll**
 Som utvecklare hos oss kan du i hög grad själv styra dina dagar både avseende arbetstid och fysisk plats. Vi arbetar i stöttande team där vi vill ta vara på just dina kompetenser och styrkor. Vi vill att du ska arbeta kreativt och innovativt med det som intresserar dig och vi arbetar i många olika spännande uppdrag. Vår målsättning är att du själv ska kunna påverka vilka uppdrag du vill arbeta i. Därmed kan du arbeta med många olika tekniker, språk och ramverk. Detta gör du självklart med stöd från kompetenta kollegor där vi lägger stor vikt vid att du får lära dig allt du behöver för tjänsten och för din fortsatta utveckling.
   

  

 Som utvecklare hos oss får du koda komplexa system och lösningar åt våra kunder. I din roll kommer du även att vara högst delaktig i uppsättningen av arkitektur i molnplattformar, varför det är viktigt att du är van att navigera i de olika funktionaliteter och möjligheter som finns. Vi jobbar ofta agilt och arbetar nära våra kunder med högt fokus på konkreta lösningar i linje med deras behov.
   

  

**Den vi söker – är det du?**
 För att passa i denna roll tror vi att du är en problemlösare som är engagerad i ditt arbete och nyfiken på att lära dig nytt. Du kan både arbeta självständigt och i team. Det är viktigt att du är van vid att förklara tekniska lösningar för beslutsfattare på olika nivåer, du är inte främmande för att vara drivande i kommunikationen mellan teknisk lösning och verksamhetsbehov. Vi tror att du tidigare har haft roller som exempelvis teamlead eller teknisk projektledare, alternativt att du informellt tagit dessa roller gentemot beställare. Därför ser vi gärna att du har
   

  

* Relevant utbildning från universitet eller yrkeshögskola
* Minst åtta års erfarenhet av systemutveckling
* Erfarenhet av att hantera komplexa integrationer och uppsättning av molnlösningar
* Erfarenhet av något eller flera av följande DevOps (Repos, Scrum Bord, Wiki, Pipelines), Agilt (Scrum, Sprint el. kanban), BI (Data Warehouse, ETL), Databricks (Microsoft/AWS), Microsoft Fabrics eller liknande tekniker T-SQL (alt. Spark SQL)
* Utmärkta kommunikationsförmågor i både svenska och engelska


**Det är meriterande om du har**
* God vana att arbeta mot olika typer av databaser
* Tidigare erfarenhet som lösningsarkitekt/IT-arkitekt
* Kunskaper inom andra programmeringsspråk
* Relevant certifiering kopplat till dina kunskaper
* Erfarenhet av något eller flera av följande - PowerBI, Azure Data Factory (alt. ETL tools), IaaC Bicep / Terraform eller DAX


**Ansökan**
 Vi behandlar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Alla sökande får återkoppling när rekryteringsprocessen är avslutad.
   

  

**Kontakta oss**
 Vill du höra mer om tjänsten och hur vi jobbar i gruppen? Välkommen att kontakta gruppchef Daniela Sandell på daniela.sandell@sweco.se eller gruppchef Anton Sandström på anton.sandstrom@sweco.se.
   

  

 På Sweco vill vi vara en arbetsplats präglad av mångfald. Vi tror att fler perspektiv breddar vår förmåga att fortsätta nå våra mål och eftersträvar mångfald i våra rekryteringsprocesser.
   

  

 Sweco planerar och utformar morgondagens hållbara samhällen och städer. Med den samlade kunskapen hos våra 23 000 arkitekter, ingenjörer och andra experter arbetar vi tillsammans med våra kunder för att möjliggöra den gröna omställningen, maximera digitaliseringens potential och stärka samhällets motståndskraft. Sweco är Europas ledande konsultföretag inom arkitektur och teknik med en omsättning på cirka 31 miljarder SEK under 2024. Företaget är noterat på Nasdaq Stockholm. www.swecogroup.com.

title: Senior Utvecklare (– Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central)
description:
Som Senior Business Central‑utvecklare blir du en nyckelperson i att skapa smarta, hållbara och affärsdrivande lösningar för våra kunder. Du arbetar nära både kollegor och kunder, leder tekniska diskussioner och säkerställer hög kvalitet i varje leverans.
   

  

**Ansvarsområden**
* Utveckling: Designa, utveckla och implementera lösningar i Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central.
* Kunddialog: Agera rådgivande expert, förstå kundbehov och omsätta dem till tekniska lösningar.
* Mentorskap: Stötta kollegor genom vägledning, kodgranskning och best practices.
* Arkitektur: Delta i tekniska beslut kring arkitektur och design för skalbara lösningar.
* Nearshoring-samarbete: Arbeta nära nearshore‑utvecklare och arkitekter för att säkra kvalitet och leverans.
* Dokumentation: Skapa och uppdatera teknisk dokumentation.
* Kvalitetssäkring: Säkerställa testning och validering innan implementering.


**Kvalifikationer**
* Kandidatexamen inom IT, datavetenskap eller liknande.
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av utveckling i Business Central.
* Starka kunskaper i AL, C/AL och relevanta verktyg.
* God förmåga att kommunicera med kunder och förstå affärsprocesser.
* Erfarenhet av projektledning eller teamledning är meriterande.
* Flytande svenska och engelska.


**Personliga egenskaper**
* Analytisk och lösningsorienterad.
* Kommunikativ och relationsskapande.
* Självgående med hög initiativförmåga.
* Teamspelare som gärna delar kunskap.


**Vi erbjuder**
* En dynamisk arbetsmiljö med engagerade kollegor
* Möjlighet att utvecklas inom försäljning och bygga en karriär hos oss
* Attraktiva förmåner och en kultur som värdesätter samarbete och innovation


 Do you want to become part of the team?
   

  

 Apply directly online with your informative application documents and your earliest possible start date.
   

  

 Do you want more #insideCOSMO?

title: Principal Salesforce Developer
description:
At Optimizely, we're on a mission to help people unlock their digital potential. We do that by reinventing how marketing and product teams work to create and optimize digital experiences across all channels. With Optimizely One, our industry-first operating system for marketers, we offer teams flexibility and choice to build their stack their way with our fully SaaS, fully decoupled, and highly composable solution.
   

  

 We are proud to help more than 10,000 businesses, including H&M, PayPal, Zoom, and Toyota, enrich their customer lifetime value, increase revenue and grow their brands. Our innovation and excellence have earned us numerous recognitions as a leader by industry analysts such as Gartner, Forrester, and IDC, reinforcing our role as a trailblazer in MarTech.
   

  

 At our core, we believe work is about more than just numbers -- it's about the people. Our culture is dynamic and constantly evolving, shaped by every employee, their actions and their stories. With over 1500 Optimizers spread across 12 global locations, our diverse team embodies the "One Optimizely" spirit, emphasizing collaboration and continuous improvement, while fostering a culture where every voice is heard and valued.
   

  

 Join us and become part of a company that's empowering people to unlock their digital potential!
   

  

 To get a sneak peek into our culture, find us on Instagram: @optimizely
   

  

**Introduction**
 Optimizely is seeking an Salesforce Developer who will report to the Director of Business Enablement, Information Technology. This role will primarily work with the Sales Operations team as well as other departmental system administrators of enterprise software applications.
   

  

 This role will ensure that Optimizely’s Salesforce instance is both scalable and meeting the needs of the business operations. You will requiore extensive experience in designing and implementing CPQ solutions within Salesforce for subscription-based business operations.
   

  

 You will guide our Salesforce strategy by championing the best practice usage of the system and its integrations with other systems like NetSuite, Gainsight, and Marketo as well as satellite software and third-party integration tools like Celigo and Workato.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Gather (or work closely with business analysts) requirements from various stakeholders relating to changes in integrations for projects related to enterprise systems, integrations, processes, change control, and operations
* Facilitate discussions with business owners in working sessions to understand requirements, find common ground, and evaluate acceptable solutions
* Create and maintain documentation on enterprise systems and satellite system integrations
* Create/update and maintain documentation in partnership with cross-departmental teams related to process and operations when related to specific work
* Develop User Acceptance Testing scenarios, identify test criteria and test new functionality/enhancements
* Identify gaps in process, operations, and systems
* Work with IT Infrastructure, enterprise system subject matter experts, and other resources to design and review technical designs and project plans for fit and purpose in accordance with system best practices
* Understand data flows between enterprise systems, in collaboration with our Enterprise Architect
* Develop and maintain trust cross-departmentally
* Work with Enterprise Architect on enterprise system roadmap
* Maintain backlog of work for IT business system analysts and project team members as appropriate
* Research, pilot, and recommend emerging technology to the IT Software Portfolio Manager
* Stay current with technological developments within the Salesforce platform, monitoring and planning for the organization to utilize new release functionality as it becomes available
* Log and track work in a structured ticketing system (JIRA) and manages changes sets in accordance with best practice
* Lead the design and implementation of CPQ solutions to optimize pricing strategies and streamline quote processes
* Work in conjunction with product development teams to ensure Salesforce solutions align with product offerings and business goals
* Design and implement integrations between Salesforce ,CPQ and NetSuite to enhance data accuracy and streamline operations
* Provide support and be available for collaboration with team members and stakeholders across different time zones, ensuring coverage until 3 PM EST/9 PM CET.


**Knowledge And Experience**
* 5+ years in administrating Salesforce
* 2+ years in deep knowledge and practice of Apex code
* Salesforce certifications as Administrator and Platform Developer and/or an architect track certification
* Experience in building complex Salesforce solution designs and reviewing/enhancing solution designs from other SFDC delivery teammates; including a working knowledge of Salesforce platform limits, order of execution, data storage impacts, and sharing and visibility
* Solid knowledge of Agile development methodologies
* Experience with Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, CPQ, & Communities required
* Knowledge of what can and should be done with configuration vs. code and adheres to a “configuration before code” mindset to minimize cost and complexity and maximize scalability
* Experience designing or building Salesforce integrations with third-party applications
* Ability to create webhooks and work with API


**Education**
* Salesforce Certifications:
* Platform Developer I and II Advanced Administrator
* Bonus: SFDC certifications: CPQ Specialist, Application Architect, System Architect; Celigo Certifications


 Optimizely is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Optimizely is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

title: Senior Android Software Engineer
description:
**At FDJ UNITED, we don't just follow the game, we reinvent it.** 




 FDJ UNITED is one of Europe’s leading betting and gaming operators, with a vast portfolio of iconic brands and a reputation for technological excellence. With more than 5,000 employees and a presence in around fifteen regulated markets, the Group offers a diversified, responsible range of games, both under exclusive rights and open to competition. We set new standards, proving that entertainment and safety can go hand in hand. Here, you’ll work alongside a team of passionate individuals dedicated to delivering the best and safest entertaining experiences for our customers every day.
 



  





 We’re looking for bold people who are eager to succeed and ready to level-up the game. If you thrive on innovation, embrace challenges, and want to make a real impact at all levels, FDJ UNITED is your playing field.
 



  





**Join us in shaping the future of gaming. Are you ready to LEVEL-UP THE GAME?** 




 As a senior software engineer, you are a core team member on whom the team relies to consistently deliver high quality solutions. You take
 



 ownership to help the team reach their goals, including actively sharing knowledge and providing feedback. You can identify and initiate activities to address improvement areas within the team. With a mature view on technical governance you have a long term perspective of the team's components
 



 and applications.
 



  





**Technical Excellence & Architecture** 



* Lead the design and implementation of complex Android features and shared modules across multiple brands.
* Drive architectural decisions, ensuring modularity, scalability, and maintainability of the Android codebase.
* Evolve and refine our use of
 **Kotlin** 
 ,
 **Jetpack Compose** 
 ,
 **Coroutines / Flow** 
 , and modern Android development patterns.
* Partner with architects and senior engineers across domains to shape long-term technical direction.



  





**Ownership Across the Lifecycle** 



* Fully own features end-to-end: design, development, testing, deployment, monitoring, and iteration.
* Proactively identify performance, stability, and architectural improvements, and drive initiatives to address them.
* Lead incident resolution for Android-related issues, guiding root-cause analysis and long-term fixes.



  





**Quality & Testing Leadership** 



* Advocate and implement advanced testing strategies: Unit, UI, integration, and performance tests.
* Collaborate with QA automation engineers to evolve shared frameworks and CI/CD quality gates.
* Ensure testing, observability, and monitoring are first-class citizens in the development process.



  





**Collaboration, Mentoring & Influence** 



* Coach mid-level and junior engineers through code reviews, pairing sessions, and technical design discussions.
* Work closely with Product Owners and designers to influence requirements, scope, and user experience early on.
* Act as a strong voice in improving team workflows, processes, and engineering best practices.



  





**Core Technical Skills** 



* Extensive experience building production-grade Android applications using
 **Kotlin** 
 .
* Strong command of
 **Jetpack Compose** 
 ,
 **Android Jetpack** 
 , and modern UI/state management patterns.
* Deep understanding of architectural patterns (MVVM, Clean Architecture, modularisation, multi-module setups).
* Advanced experience writing
 **Unit Tests** 
 ,
 **UI Tests** 
 (Espresso, Compose UI tests), and scaling automated testing suites.
* Strong knowledge of Android performance, memory management, profiling, and debugging tools.
* Proven experience integrating with backend APIs and managing complex data flows.
* Experience with CI/CD pipelines and Android tooling such as
 **Gradle** 
 ,
 **GitHub Actions** 
 ,
 **Jenkins** 
 ,
 **Fastlane** 
 , or similar.



  





**Leadership & Professional Skills** 



* Ability to influence architecture and long-term technical strategy.
* Strong mentorship skills; you help others grow and lead by example.
* Skilled in balancing product delivery with long-term maintainability and quality.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to different audiences.
* Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment with high ownership and autonomy.

title: Product Manager II – Data Platform (Data Collection)
description:
The Platform team creates the technology that enables Spotify to learn quickly and scale easily, enabling rapid growth in our users and our business around the globe. Spanning many disciplines, we work to make the business work; creating the infrastructure, tooling, frameworks, and capabilities needed to welcome a billion customers.
   

  

**About The Team**
 You’ll join a new team within the Data Collection Product Area in Spotify’s Data Platform Studio. We’re building a unified layer of developer-focused tools and experiences that sit on top of Gabito and UBI, our foundational event delivery and user-behavior instrumentation products. The team works on products like the Data Application Portal, the Client Instrumentation Browser, Gabito Inspector, and UBI Inspector—helping Spotify engineers instrument, validate, and understand telemetry with confidence.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Deliver the initial roadmap for this new squad and shape the long-term direction of our developer tooling investments.
* Build deep expertise in user-behavior instrumentation, event delivery, schemas, and developer workflows.
* Define and track success metrics focused on correctness, productivity, and adoption.
* Run structured product discovery with engineering teams; translate insights into clear product improvements.
* Partner closely with the Engineering Manager and Staff Engineer to define MVPs, sequencing, and technical tradeoffs.
* Communicate clearly across product, engineering, and leadership stakeholders to drive alignment and momentum.
* Explore opportunities to apply AI/ML to developer tooling or product discovery.


 Who You Are:
   

  

* You know how to navigate ambiguous, fast-paced technical environments and turn that ambiguity into clarity.
* You are experienced with developer-focused products and have the technical depth to reason about code, instrumentation, and telemetry.
* You have a deep understanding of events, schemas, data pipelines, or telemetry systems.
* You know how to run structured discovery with internal users, especially engineers.
* You care about strong partnerships and work well with engineering management and tech leads.
* You have a track record of thoughtful prioritization, roadmapping, and stakeholder alignment.
* You use data to inform decisions and are comfortable establishing product metrics from scratch.
* You have curiosity about how developers work and enthusiasm for improving DevEx at scale.
* You have interest or experience applying AI to developer tooling or product processes.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role can be based in Stockholm or London.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! You should expect some level of requisite amount of in-person engagements with a hybrid working approach.


 We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us. Find our AI notice here: https://lifeatspotify.com/ai-notice
   

  

 Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Associate Professional Services Consultant Intern 2026
description:
**Description**
 The role starts in June 2026.
   

  

 Do you want to experiment with innovative technologies, including Cloud Computing, Machine Learning, and GenAI? Are you passionate about educating, training, designing, and building cloud computing solutions to help customer solve their most challenging problems? Amazon Web Services (AWS), a leader in Cloud Computing, is seeking interns to join our AWS Professional Services Internship program. This is a unique opportunity to play a key role in a fast-growing business and to deliver value to AWS customers of all sizes from startups to global brands. The skills and experiences you gain will be highly sought after throughout the industry and give you the opportunity for the career of a lifetime. The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that helps AWS customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud. We deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries. In addition to working alongside our customers, we share our experience through technical artifacts and proof of concept demos. As a Professional Services intern, you will gain hands-on experience in cloud computing, develop business acumen, and learn about Amazon’s peculiar culture. You will work on projects, have the opportunity to obtain the AWS certifications, and attend professional development events. This internship can lead to a full-time role in Stockholm, that has up to 75% travel associated. While many of our customers engage ProServe virtually, there is always the potential that a customer might choose to include travel in their contract. Upon successful completion of the internship program, selected interns will receive a full-time offer to join the Professional Services and go into our AWS Technical training program. This program is an accelerated career development program for recent graduates and early career professionals entering technical roles to advance their skills and help customers design and build flexible and resilient cloud-based solutions. While in this program, you will learn key technical and professional skills from top AWS subject matter experts that you can use in your career working with AWS’s customers.
   

  

 Amazon internships are full-time (40 hours/week) for 12 consecutive weeks, starting June 2026. Applicants should have at a minimum one quarter/semester remaining after their internship concludes. This internship role is required to be onsite 5 days a week in Stockholm location.
   

  

 Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis. For an update on your status, or to confirm your application was submitted successfully, please login to your candidate portal. Please note that we are reviewing a high volume of applications and appreciate your patience.
   

  

 The program offers the opportunity to specialize in an area of interest including:
   

  

 Application Developer - AppDev resources are specialists in designing applications that run natively in the cloud using programming languages such as Python, JavaScript, Typescript, etc. They are experts in building programs that run on any number of platforms including virtualized instances, containers, or server less architecture. They are full stack developers with backend, frontend, and UX skillsets.
   

  

 Data & Analytics - Data & Analytics role supports our services that leverage data and produce business insights, which may include using Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence/Generative Artificial Intelligence (ML/AI/GenAI). Helping our customers use and integrate Big Data services in what is arguably our industry’s most exciting space. The portfolio of services covers EMR (Hadoop), DynamoDB (NoSQL), MongoDB, Apache Cassandra, Amazon Q, and Bedrock.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.
   

  

 Work/Life Harmony
   

  

 Our team puts a high value on work-life harmony. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment AND WE encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.
   

  

 EMEA AUTA Team
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Enrolled in a Bachelor degree or greater degree program (e.g. Master degree) in a STEM related field such as Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology, or other related fields, with a conferral date in 2027.
* Experience with Java and Python.
* Experience with one or more of the following programming languages/technologies: Typescript, React, Angular, Node.js, Ruby, GoLang, R, C, or C++
* Experience with one or more of the following: networking fundamentals, security, databases (relational and/or NoSQL), operating systems (Unix, Linux, and/or Windows)
* Fluency in English and Swedish languages


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience with software development lifecycle (SDLC) and agile/iterative methodologies
* Knowledge of the primary AWS services such as EC2, ELB, RDS, VPC, Route53, and S3
* Basic experience setting up cloud environment with AWS
* Experience with infrastructure as code, ops automation, and configuration management tools such as Chef, Puppet, or Ansible


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch) - G54
   

  

 Job ID: A3158756

title: Master Data Specialist - OKQ8 Tech
description:
*Hela samhället ställer om mot en fossilfri framtid. Vi vill visa vägen i utvecklingen av vår bransch, så att fler kan ta sig fram, ta hand om sitt fordon och driva verksamheter med ett så lågt klimatavtryck som möjligt. Vill du vara med och bidra till hållbar utveckling, på riktigt? Välkommen att följa med på vår resa!*
 Som MDM Specialist hos OKQ8 kommer du att ha ett ansvar för vår MDM-plattform Profisee, inklusive integrationer, konfigurationer och automatisering av dataflöden. Rollen innefattar även vissa Data Steward-uppgifter, såsom kvalitetssäkring och governance.
   

  

**Om rollen:**
 OKQ8 har idag en diversifierad verksamhet med en stor mängd system som tillhandahåller data och transaktioner. I detta brokiga landskap nyckeln till ordning och reda fungerande masterdata och en enhetlig källa till sanningen. Här blir Profisee en viktig komponent till övriga plattformar samt till Data och Analytics som inom OKQ8 till största del bygger på Microsofts komponenter såsom exempelvis Power BI, Fabric, Power Platform, Azure Synapse etc.
   

  

 Som MDM Specialist kommer du att:
   

  

* Designa, konfigurera och vidareutveckla vår Profisee-lösning
* Utveckla och underhålla integrationer mellan Profisee och andra system
* Skapa automatiserade arbetsflöden och pipelines för att hämta, organisera och transformera data från olika källor
* Delta i tekniska arkitekturdiskussioner kring masterdata och informationsstruktur
* Ansvara för plattformens tekniska roadmap och förbättringar
* Samarbeta med våra Tech-team för att säkerställa att dataflöden följer bästa praxis
* Tillhandahålla utbildning och kunskapsdelning kring Profisee och MDM


 Du kommer även att jobba delvis med att:
   

  

* Säkerställa att data är korrekt, aktuell och tillförlitlig
* Definiera och tillämpa policyer, standarder och procedurer för datahantering
* Ansvara för hela datalivscykeln – från insamling till arkivering
* Skapa och underhålla metadata för att underlätta förståelsen av data
* Fungera som en länk mellan Tech och verksamheten för att säkerställa att data används korrekt och ändamålsenligt
* Delta i initiativ och projekt för att förbättra vår data och bidra till utvecklingen av framtida tekniska lösningar för informationsförsörjning


 Vi tror att du är fokuserad, lösningsorienterad och analytisk. Du kan arbeta självgående och du brinner för ditt område och vill ha möjligheter att vidareutvecklas. Du tar eget ansvar för att hitta lösningar, driver ständiga förbättringar och håller deadlines.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har/är:**
* Högskoleexamen i datavetenskap, informationsteknologi eller ett närliggande område
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av Master Data Management, inklusive praktisk erfarenhet av Profisee eller liknande plattformar
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av teknisk implementation, konfiguration och integration av MDM-lösningar
* Kommunikationsförmåga för att samarbeta med tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska


 Det hade även varit bra om du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av Azure, Fabric, Master Data Services
* God kunskap inom Power BI, Power Platform, Azure Synapse
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD och DevOps-processer
* Kunskap kring andra MDM- eller datastyrningsplattformar
* Erfarenhet och intresse av statistik, Machine Learning och AI
* Erfarenhet som MDM Developer, Data Engineer, Data Developer, Data Scientist eller liknande


 Vi uppmuntrar dig att ansöka även om du inte känner att du uppfyller alla ovan nämnda kvalifikationer. Det viktigaste är att du har ett starkt driv, engagerad, skärpt och vill vara med och bidra till hållbar utveckling på riktigt!
   

  

 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Harri Ikeda Karjalainen via harri.ikedakarjalainen@okq8.se
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 Hos oss på OKQ8 får du arbeta i en flexibel miljö med viktiga och varierande arbetsuppgifter. Vi uppmuntrar samarbete, innovation och utveckling – och vi tror på att vi tillsammans gör varandra bättre. Här blir du en del av en familjär kultur där vi stöttar varandra, har roligt tillsammans och där du ges möjlighet att växa och göra skillnad. Vi vill vara ett företag som speglar samhället, med en inkluderande kultur som minskar utanförskap och främjar mångfald.
   

  

*I rekryteringsprocessen ingår både psykometriska tester och kompetensbaserade intervjuer, med syfte att främja en rättvis utvärdering för alla kandidater.*
 För den här tjänsten behöver du vara medborgare i ett EU/EES-land eller ha permanent uppehållstillstånd i Sverige.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan!** 
 Om företaget
 **Ditt livs kanske viktigaste jobb. På riktigt.**
 Vi vet att det är en vågad sak att säga, men vi menar verkligen varje ord. Oavsett om det handlar om ditt första jobb, ditt sista jobb, eller om du har modet att anta en ny utmaning, tror vi att du kan få ditt livs kanske viktigaste jobb här hos oss. På riktigt.

title: SW Project Manager to DeLaval PMO in Sweden
description:
**SW Project M anager to DeLaval PMO in Sweden**
 Do you want to work in a global company where you can contribute to a more sustainable food production? DeLaval is a leading developer, manufacturer and supplier of solutions for dairy farmers around the world. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers do more with less.
   

  

 We are now looking for a SW Project Manager with experience from development of Embedded Systems to the DeLaval Project Management Office.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Project and Program execution Lead the planning, execution, and follow- up of software deliveries while efficiently managing dependencies and risk efficiently. Ensure that software development aligns with system requirements and architecture.
* Team Leadership and Collaboration Build efficient program and project teams, provide direction, and fostering open communication to achieve objectives efficiently.
* Stakeholder collaboration Manage relationships and communications with stakeholders, including upper management, product management, IT, engineering, supply chain, and market, ensuring transparency and involvement.
* Strategic planning Establishing goals and plans by understanding and aligning with long-term organizational goals, securing the project expected benefit and business case.


**Qualifications And Experience**
* Extensive experience in managing software development projects within a product development environment, preferably in complex systems integrating both hardware and software components.
* Strong understanding of how hardware and software components interact, including interfaces, integration and testing.
* Several years of experience with agile methodologies, combined with the ability to adapt to hybrid approaches incorporating elements of a more traditional waterfall model.
* Proven ability to lead cross-functional engineering teams and manage technical dependencies.
* Strong skills in identifying and managing technical risks related to software delivery and hardware integration.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills at both operational and strategic levels.
* Master of Science in Engineering or equivalent degree.
* It is highly meriting if you also know how to facilitate session to create and update system anatomies.


 As a person, you are driven and well-structured, with the ability to operate effectively at both operational and strategic levels. You bring a strong customer focus and communicate clearly and confidently. You work collaboratively, approach others with humility and respect, and build strong relationships across teams. Your problem-solving abilities and experience in intercultural collaboration enable you to work seamlessly across diverse teams and organizational levels.
   

  

**Working at DeLaval**
 Our core values Passion, People, Professionals and Partnerships connect individuals across entities and geographies. Success is far more than knowledge – it is strongly related to behaviours. At DeLaval we are all guided by our three preferred behaviours: Set Direction, Make Things Happen and One DeLaval.
   

  

 We Offer You a Workplace Like No Other, Where State-of-the-art Technology Goes Hand In Hand With Animal Welfare. DeLaval Is a Part Of The Tetra Laval Group Together With Tetra Pak And Sidel. In Addition, We Offer
   

  

* A secure employment and benefits from the collective agreement (occupational pension, work-related accident insurance, parental leave, reduction of working hours).
* Parental leave compensation (approx. 10 percent of the employee's monthly salary).
* Wellness contribution of 4 000 SEK/year.
* Private health insurance.
* Flexible working hours.
* 30 days paid annual leave.


**Additional Information**
 The position will be part of the Division Product Development and will report to the Swedish PMO manager at Product Development. This is a full-time permanent position based at DeLaval’s headquarters in Tumba, south of Stockholm. We offer a hybrid workplace model, allowing flexibility to work remotely. Travel will be part of this position.
   

  

 We review applications ongoing. We do not accept applications via email, however if you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact us. Please note that response times may be longer than usual due to holiday periods. We appreciate your patience and understanding.
   

  

**Contact**
 Hiring manager: Marie Engstrand, marie.engstrand@delaval.com
   

  

 Recruiter: Agnes Edbom, agnes.edbom@delaval.com
   

  

**About DeLaval**
 Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions.
   

  

 Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,500 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group.
   

  

 See more at corporate.delaval.com

title: Adobe Campaign Classic Technical Consultant (Insurance)
description:
At Capgemini, you’ll have the opportunity to shape your career in a way that suits you, supported by a global community of experts who inspire and empower you. We believe in reimagining what’s possible - using technology to build a more sustainable, inclusive world. Our Financial Services team is at the forefront of this mission. As a reliable partner we guide our customers such as major banks and insurance companies with everything from strategy and planning to implementation and management.
   

  

**Your role**
 As an Adobe Campaign Classic Consultant, you will play a key role in customizing and developing solutions within Adobe Campaign Classic to meet requirements. Collaborating closely with cross-functional teams, you will deliver solutions that align with business objectives. These solutions may include technical workflows, campaign triggers, landing pages, and custom implementations. Your responsibilities also cover incident management. Additionally, you will manage projects with accuracy and attention to detail, ensuring alignment with the global Adobe Campaign strategy.
   

  

**Your profile**
* 6+ years of experience with marketing automation solutions like Adobe Campaign Classic and Adobe Campaign Standard.
* Knowledge of Marketing Management across multiple Channels (Email, SMS, Outbound, Direct Mail, Push).
* 3+ years of developer experience with Adobe Campaign Classic.
* Experience with integrating Adobe Campaign Classic with other Adobe solutions, external DBs and custom API integrations.
* Proficiency in JavaScript, XML, HTML/CSS
* Insurance domain experience is preferred.
* Proficiency in Swedish is a plus and candidates based in Sweden will be prioritized.


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* You get to work with major customers within banking and insurance, in exciting and varied roles, giving you the opportunity to develop both personally and professionally.
* The freedom to make decisions, manage your time, and work independently - fostering creativity, innovation, and job satisfaction.
* An extensive benefits package, including parental benefits, occupational and flex pension, private insurance, preventive healthcare, and more.
* A variety of social and wellness activities, from sports and health programs to cultural events and art initiatives, designed to bring employees together and enrich work life.


*As part of our recruitment process, identity verification and background checks may occasionally be conducted. More information will be provided if applicable.*
*We’re in the midst of the holiday season and we hope you’re having a pleasant end of the year! We’ll start reviewing applications during January and look forward to possibly connecting with you soon!*
**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is an AI-powered global business and technology transformation partner, delivering tangible business value. We imagine the future of organizations and make it real with AI, technology and people. With our strong heritage of nearly 60 years, we are a responsible and diverse group of 420,000 team members in more than 50 countries. We deliver end-to-end services and solutions with our deep industry expertise and strong partner ecosystem, leveraging our capabilities across strategy, technology, design, engineering and business operations. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

**Make it real |** 
**www.capgemini.com**

title: PEGA-utvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Minst 4 års erfarenhet
* Flerårig erfarenhet som Pega-utvecklare
* Flerårig erfarenhet av API:er, integrationer och databaser
* Vana vid verktyg som GitLab, Azure DevOps, containers m.m.
* Erfarenhet av testmetodik och kvalitetssäkring


**Meriterande**
* Svenska i tal och skrift


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 19-01-2026
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.
   

  

 Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.
