**Here’s how you’ll be making an impact:**

Architecting the Future of Analytics: You will design, develop, and maintain the functionality within the Analytic Engine, translating complex product requirements into elegant, high-performance code.
Driving Engineering Excellence: By performing deep code reviews and mentoring team members, you will help maintain our high standards for integrity and software craftsmanship.
Ensuring Seamless Reliability: You’ll take ownership of the full development cycle, including automated testing, to ensure that every fix or feature addition strengthens the engine’s core.
Collaborative Problem Solving: Working alongside senior architects and product management, you’ll help identify the right designs for implementations that scale.
Direct Customer Value: Your work directly enables our customers to process more data, faster. When you optimize a calculation or solve a scalability bottleneck, the impact is felt immediately across the entire Qlik ecosystem.
**We’re looking for a teammate with:**

10+ years of software development experience, with a minimum of 7 years dedicated to C++.
A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field, or similar.
Familiarity with Linux development environments and modern toolsets like Git, GitHub, Jenkins, and Jira.
Experience in high-performance computing or microservices, with an understanding of API development and test-driven development.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with a proven ability to drive cross-team activities (design, testing, and documentation).
A "Quality First" mindset and a passion for working in a multicultural, Agile team environment.
**The location for this role is:**

Lund, Sweden (Hybrid)
**Apply now and help change how the world transforms complex data landscapes into actionable insights and turns complex data challenges into new opportunities!**
**More about Qlik and who we are:**

Find out more about ‘Life at Qlik’ on social: Instagram, LinkedIn, YouTube, and X/Twitter, and to see all other opportunities to join us and our values, check out our Careers Page.
**What else do we offer?**

Genuine career progression pathways and mentoring programs.
Culture of innovation, technology, collaboration, and openness.
Flexible, diverse, and international work environment.

Giving back is a huge part of our culture. Alongside an extra “change the world” day plus another for personal development, we also highly encourage participation in our Corporate Responsibility Employee Programs

If you need assistance applying for a role due to a disability, please submit your request via email to accessibilityta@qlik.com. Any information you provide will be treated according to Qlik’s Recruitment Privacy Notice. Qlik may only respond to emails related to accommodation requests.

Qlik is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Qlik via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Qlik. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Qlik as a result of the referral or through other means.
company_description: Qlik is a global software company headquartered in King of Prussia, Pennsylvania. Qlik provides an end-to-end, real-time data integration and analytics cloud platform.

title: Junior IT-supporttekniker till Auctionet
description:
Auctionet är en internationell marknadsplats där auktionshus från Sverige, Storbritannien, Finland, Spanien, Tyskland och Danmark säljer möbler, konst, designföremål, samlarobjekt och mycket mer.


Nu söker vi en **junior IT-supporttekniker** till vår IT-avdelning – en perfekt möjlighet för dig som vill ta ditt första steg inom IT och arbeta i en internationell miljö där service, struktur och lärande står i fokus.

### **Om rollen**


I rollen som IT-supporttekniker arbetar du med **first line-support** och är en viktig kontaktpunkt för våra användare när tekniken inte fungerar som den ska. Du hjälper till med felsökning, användarstöd och enklare administration, och eskalerar mer komplexa ärenden vidare i teamet.


Du blir en del av ett mindre IT-team där du får arbeta nära erfarna kollegor, lära dig nya tekniker och successivt ta mer ansvar. Rollen passar dig som är ny i IT-branschen och vill bygga en stabil grund inom support och IT-drift.

**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter**

* Ge tekniskt stöd till användare i Windows- och Mac-miljö
* First line IT-support via e-post, ärendehanteringssystem och vid behov telefon
* Onboarding och offboarding av medarbetare
* Installation och konfigurering av datorer och kringutrustning
* Dokumentation av ärenden och lösningar
* Eskalering av ärenden till andra specialister vid behov


Resor och övertidsarbete kan förekomma i samband med till exempel utrullningar eller förändringar i verksamheten. Tjänsten är placerad på vårt huvudkontor i centrala Stockholm. Tillträde omgående, eller enligt överenskommelse.

### **Om teamet**


Du blir en del av ett litet och kompetent IT-team som arbetar nära både varandra och verksamheten. Idag består avdelningen av två systemadministratörer.


Auctionet har cirka 170 medarbetare och är moderbolag i en större koncern med omkring 400 medarbetare i flera länder. Vårt huvudkontor ligger nära Stureplan i Stockholm, och vi har logistikcenter i Malmö, Stockholm, Göteborg, Westbury och Köln.

### **Om dig**


För att lyckas i rollen har du ett genuint intresse för IT och tycker om att hjälpa andra. Du trivs i en serviceinriktad roll där problemlösning är en naturlig del av vardagen och där du får kombinera teknik med kommunikation.


Som person är du nyfiken, ansvarstagande och strukturerad. Du tar dig an uppgifter med ett professionellt bemötande, är inte rädd för att ställa frågor och vill utvecklas vidare inom IT. Du klarar av att hantera flera ärenden parallellt och ser till att de avslutas på ett ordnat och noggrant sätt.

**Avgörande kvalifikationer**

* Gymnasieutbildning med inriktning mot IT eller motsvarande
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
* God servicekänsla och ett professionellt bemötande
* Strukturerad och noggrann i ärendehantering
* Stark vilja att lära dig nya system och utvecklas inom IT

**Meriterande kvalifikationer**

* Erfarenhet av IT-support, servicedesk eller liknande (t.ex. praktik eller extrajobb)
* Erfarenhet av Google Workspace och/eller Microsoft 365
* Grundläggande kunskaper i Active Directory
* Grundläggande nätverkskunskaper

### **Vår rekryteringsprocess**


Vi vill ha en tydlig och transparent rekryteringsprocess.

* Inledande telefonintervju
* Två till tre intervjuer där vi pratar om dig, rollen och Auctionet
* En mindre hemuppgift
* Förhoppningsvis en match som känns rätt för båda parter


Under processen får du möjlighet att träffa de personer du kommer att arbeta nära.

### **Ansökan**


Vi går igenom ansökningar löpande, så skicka gärna in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, dock senast **15 februari 2026**.

### **Om Auctionet**


Auctionet grundades 2011 av ett team med unik erfarenhet av onlineauktioner. Läs mer om Auctionet här.


År 2021 förvärvade Auctionet Stockholms Auktionsverk, vilket gjorde oss till Nordens största marknadsplats för auktioner och en av de största i världen. Vi äger och driver både världens äldsta auktionshus (grundat 1674) och det näst äldsta (1681) – ett arv som innebär över 350 års arbete med cirkulär ekonomi och hållbarhet.


Bli en del av vår vision: **att göra värdefulla föremål tillgängliga för alla, överallt.**

title: Desktop Support Engineer -Sweden
description:
**Why join us?** 




 BlupaceTech is a world-class IT development company that strives to improve its processes constantly. The company has been in business since 2008 and employs over 160+ people in more than 4 countries. Blupace provides innovative software solutions for businesses of all sizes, with a focus on Web & Mob Applications, e-commerce websites, data & Analytics , Field services and more. We are passionate about developing innovative technology solutions that make a difference. We have the expertise and experience to provide custom-tailored solutions for your business, whatever your field may be. Our team is dedicated to providing you with the best possible service, and we are always looking for new ways to improve our products and services. We operate in different locations which includes UK, France, Germany and Belgium.
 



  





**Where you’ll be working: Looking for DSS** 



* **It is a Sweden -Stockholm ,Norrlandsgatan 16, based contractual opportunity**
* **Band 2 engineer ,Backfill Engineer - Dispatch**
* **No Sponsorship provided for this role.**
* **Language - Swedish- B2 -C1 proficiency as a mandate**
* **Required Exp. -4+ yrs**



  





**Job Description** 




 Desktop Technician will provide day to day local\remote desktop support, receive inbound calls, answer questions, troubleshoot and document steps performed to resolve challenges with hardware, software and application issues in a ticketing system. The candidate will also need to facilitate customer resolution for calls and engage their supervisors and managers to ensure operational consistency across all shifts within the IT Support Center. Desktop Support Engineer provides Break Fix, fault diagnosis and resolution. Providing fault analysis to customer’s various core operating systems and platforms, as well be able to provide support and apply desktop fault resolution for the approved application suite.
 



  





 Position Responsibilities and Functions
 


* Provide first/second level contact and problem resolution for customer issues.
* Work with vendors to remediate complex AV issues as needed.
* Provide timely communication on issue status and resolution.
* Maintain ticket updates for all reported incidents.


1. Install, upgrade, support and troubleshoot XP, Windows 7, Windows 8.1, Windows 10 and Microsoft Office 2010, Cisco Jabber, another authorized desktop application.
2. Should have basic knowledge of Mac operating system, to support Apple pc users.
3. Install, upgrade, support and troubleshoot for printers, computer hardware.
4. Performs general preventative maintenance tasks on computers, laptops, printers.
5. Performs remedial repairs on Desktops, laptops, printers and any other authorized peripheral equipment.
6. Use diagnostic tools to troubleshoot problems associated with network connectivity, and workstation hardware/software.
7. Broad experience of IT with basic understanding of Networks, Servers, Audio/Visual, Smart Devices and Telecoms.
8. This position requires the ability to work in a project-based environment requiring flexibility and teamwork. Performs other duties as assigned.



  





**Candidate Required Minimum Qualifications and Skills** 



* Bachelor Degree or equivalent in Computer Science or related field.
* CompTIA A+, Microsoft Certified Professional (MCP) or better.
* Minimum of 18 months’ years of IT experience.
* Windows 7-10, Microsoft Active Directory, utilization of GPOs, MS Office 365, PC hardware installation and troubleshooting, Enterprise anti-virus solutions, Helpdesk ticketing systems.
* Mobile device management including IOS and Android devices, Enterprise encryption solutions, Windows PC/laptop management via Active Directory.
* Proven analytical, troubleshooting and problem solving skills.
* Proven ability to multi-task, effectively determine priorities and meet SLA’s.
* Excellent communication relationship-building and internal customer service skills.
* Adaptable and flexible in a fast-changing industry and work environment.
* Willing to work off-hours and weekends when required for projects or emergency support.



  





**The Package** 



* We offer a competitive salary and a great benefits package. Blupace is committed to promoting a diverse, open and collaborative work environment – a place where we can be ourselves and succeed on merit. We believe an environment like this is where ideas can truly flourish and balanced with a healthy dose of fun, it ensures that our people stay and develop.

title: Technical Support Specialist
description:
Join us as our
 **Technical Support Specialist** 
 at
 **Dedalus** 
 , one of the World’s leading healthcare technology companies, in
 **Stockholm, Sweden** 
 to do the best work of your career and make a profound impact in providing better care for a healthier planet.
 



  





**What you’ll achieve** 




 As
 **Technical Support Specialist** 
 at Dedalus Sweden, you will ensure the reliability, performance and user satisfaction of clinical applications and infrastructure across hospitals and care facilities are maintained. You will join a team of support specialists, collaborate with clinical stakeholders and drive continuous improvement in service delivery making a profound impact throughout the healthcare sector.
 



  





**You will:** 



* Ensure timely resolution of incidents and service requests, with a strong focus on patient safety, data integrity and system uptime.
* Act as the escalation point for complex technical issues, coordinating with vendors (ISP(internet service provider) within system, Navigation system provider) , IT teams, and clinical departments.
* Collaborate with R&D, implementation, infrastructure and cybersecurity teams to ensure seamless integration and secure operations.
* Hold a leading role in a team providing technical support for healthcare applications, including EHR/EMR systems both at the hospital and in mobile pre-hospital settings
* Monitor and report on support KPIs, SLAs and compliance with healthcare regulations
* Develop and maintain support documentation, SOPs and training materials tailored to clinical users.
* Participate in change management and risk assessments for system updates and deployments.
* Stay informed on healthcare IT trends, regulatory changes, and emerging technologies.



  





  





**Take the next step towards your dream career** 




  





**At Dedalus Life flows through our software** 
 . Every day we do something special by helping caregivers and health professionals deliver better care to their served communities. Take the next step in your career that will make a profound impact. Here’s what you’ll need to succeed:
 



  





**Essential Requirements** 



* 3 – 5 + years of relevant experience in technical support or IT service delivery, preferably in a healthcare or regulated environment.
* Strong understanding of clinical workflows and healthcare IT systems.
* Excellent troubleshooting skills across software, hardware, and network layers.
* Experience with ITSM tools (e.g., ServiceNow, Jira) and remote support platforms.
* Strong communication and leadership skills, with a customer-centric and safety-first mindset.
* Fluent in Swedish language.
* Work Mode – Hybrid: 3 Days Work from Office- 2 Days Work from Home



  





**Desirable Requirements** 



* Bachelor's degree in IT, Health Informatics or related field
* Familiarity with healthcare data standards (e.g., HL7, DICOM) and compliance frameworks.
* Certifications in ITIL, or healthcare IT
* Fluent in English and other European languages



  





**We are Dedalus, come join us** 




 Dedalus is committed to providing an engaging, rewarding work experience that reflects the passion our employees bring to our mission of helping clinicians and nurses deliver better care to their served communities.
 



 Our company fosters a culture where employees are encouraged to learn and innovate, and to enable and enhance clinical co-operation and processes while making a meaningful difference for millions of people around the world. Each person is the end point and the starting point of the Group’s activities and the ultimate beneficiary. For this reason, we are so proud of doing our very special jobs each day.
 



 Our company is enriched by a diverse population of 7,600 people in more than 40 countries that work together to innovate and drive better healthcare options for millions of patients around the world. We are the people of Dedalus.
 



  





**Application closing date: 30th November 2025** 




  





 At Dedalus, innovation starts with inclusion. As a company driven by our Core Values, we know diversity and inclusion are key enablers for us to succeed and grow. Our international footprint connects people from across the globe and we are committed to celebrating diverse backgrounds, skills, experiences and creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. ‘Pursuing Diversity and Inclusion’ is one of our Core Values and a part of our ‘Dedalus DNA’, which drives us to build a respectful, diverse, and inclusive environment by recognising the unique needs, perspectives, and potential of all members of our community. Dedalus is proud to promote diversity, inclusion, equity, and equality and is committed to creating a safe and inclusive culture where we celebrate diversity in all forms and empower everyone to be the best they can be.
 



  





 Our diversity & inclusion commitment – Dedalus Global
 



  





 Life Flows Through Our Software

title: IT Systems & Support Technician
description:
**\*\*YOU MUST BE A CITIZEN OF THE EU OR EEA OR HAVE VALID WORK PERMIT TO WORK IN SWEDEN.\*\*** 




  






 This is a full-time, onsite position based in Stockholm, Sweden.
 




  






 Do you have a passion for gaming and IT operations? As a part of my3Twelve, you will have an opportunity to join a dynamic team supporting a global enterprise client. My3Twelve is seeking a technically skilled professional who thrives in both hands-on IT support and strategic systems administration. This role is ideal for someone eager to grow into advanced responsibilities, independently drive projects, and act as a technical project manager with minimal oversight.
 




  





**Key Responsibilities** 




  






 ·      Provide front-line technical support, troubleshooting hardware/software issues, and delivering desktop support across multiple platforms
 





 ·      Manage onboarding/offboarding IT tasks (PC build-out, dev kit setup, etc.)
 





 ·      Maintain and optimize a large fleet of test devices (Windows, Android, Chrome OS, etc.)
 





 ·      Transition lab operations to cloud-hosted environments
 





 ·      Develop and deploy automation scripts (PowerShell or similar)
 





 ·      Set up lab infrastructure (racking, cabling, servers, provisioning)
 





 ·      Own and improve processes for managing technical requests, tracking issues, and communicating status
 





 ·      Deliver both tactical (day-to-day) and strategic (long-term) IT projects
 





 ·      Evaluate and recommend hardware solutions for diverse technical needs
 





 ·      Monitor, maintain, and secure servers, networks, and computer systems
 





 ·      Implement system updates, patches, backups, and disaster recovery operations
 





 ·      Ensure compliance with security, privacy, and regulatory requirements
 





 ·      Collaborate with cross-functional teams to resolve issues and enhance system performance
 





 ·      Document IT procedures and system configurations
 





 ·      Independently drive projects to completion, acting as a technical project manager:
 





 ·      Develop project plans and timelines
 





 ·      Proactively identify and mitigate risks
 





 ·      Communicate project status and milestones to stakeholders
 





 ·      Facilitate team meetings and stakeholder reviews
 





 ·      Track KPIs and project outcomes
 





 ·      Capture lessons learned and implemented best practices
 




  





**Qualifications** 




  






 ·      3–5 years’ experience in IT operations or similar roles
 





 ·      Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field
 





 ·      Strong scripting skills (PowerShell, C# preferred)
 





 ·      Deep knowledge of operating systems (Windows, Linux), as well as using and automating Azure and XML
 





 ·      Experience with network administration, security, and Azure virtual machines
 





 ·      Familiarity with corporate IT environments (AAD, AD, Directory Services, SharePoint, ADO)
 





 ·      Experience with ITIL-based helpdesk systems and ticketing platforms (JIRA, Autotask, Kaseya, etc.)
 





 ·      Ability to work independently and collaboratively
 





 ·      Service-minded, positive, can-do attitude
 





 ·      Highly Recommended:
 





 ·      Experience in IT operations/engineering for a game studio
 





 ·      Certifications: CompTIA Network+, CompTIA Security+, Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator Associate
 





 ·      Experience troubleshooting client issues in complex corporate environments
 





 ·      Experience in technical lab environments and front-line IT operations
 




  






 Pay: 30 000,00kr - 50 000,00kr per month

title: Head of Information Technology
description:
**Head of IT Operations**




  





 We are supporting a well‑established Nordic organisation with operations across several countries as they continue a major modernisation of their technical landscape. The company has a large network of partners, strong recurring revenue, and a long history in its sector. With a significant digital transformation underway, they are now looking for a Head of IT Core Operations to join their leadership team in Stockholm.
 



  





**The Role:** 




 You will lead a team of six specialists covering security, networking, cloud infrastructure, on‑prem environments, and the Microsoft based workplace platform. This role oversees daily IT operations, drives improvements across infrastructure and automation, and manages external operations partners. It reports directly to the CIO and plays a key part in shaping the organisation’s technology direction.
 



  





 The environment includes Azure, on‑prem data centres, a WAN covering more than 60 sites, and a Microsoft 365 setup supporting over 1300 employees. Much of the core system landscape is being rebuilt, making this a crucial position in a large, ongoing transformation.
 



  





**Core Responsibilities:** 



* Ensure stability and quality across 2nd and 3rd line support
* Lead incident management, escalation and root cause analysis
* Maintain DR plans, backups, SLAs and security practices
* Drive automation using IaC and CI/CD approaches
* Improve monitoring, observability and standardisation
* Manage the IT Operations team including performance, development and budgeting
* Contribute to IT strategy, governance and long term planning



  





**Experience required:** 



* At least 3 years in IT operations or infrastructure leadership
* Experience with hybrid IT (on‑prem and Azure)
* Knowledge of Terraform or Ansible and CI/CD pipelines
* Strong grounding in security, compliance and incident management
* Fluent Swedish and eligible to work in Sweden



**Beneficial:** 
 experience in larger organisations, governance models, automation, vendor management and people leadership.
 



  





**Other Key Points:** 



* Very stable company with long term customers and reliable revenue
* Major greenfield modernisation programme already in motion
* Opportunity to shape core IT foundations and influence long term architecture
* Company car, 30 days vacation, flexible working hours, hybrid model and union benefits

title: Technology Contract Manager – Infrastructure & Security Operation | SEB, Solna
description:
SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fuelled by collaboration. From COBOL to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone. Are you ready to take on a new challenge? If so, you'll be interested in this opportunity!
   

  

**Are you experienced in technology, finance, and vendor management— and looking for your new challenge?** 
 Join us at SEB and help shape the future of infrastructure services in a dynamic and collaborative environment.
   

  

 Hi, I’m Andreas Hallbygård, Team Manager for Area Services within Infrastructure & Security Operations. I’m looking for a driven and solution-oriented Contract Manager to join my team, with a focus on contract, financial and service management.
   

  

**About Us**
 Infrastructure & Security Operations is part of SEB’s Technology division. Our mission is to deliver world-class infrastructure and security services in areas such as Network, Operational Security, Observability, and Cloud. My team works cross-functionally to support these delivery areas with vendor, financial and service management.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Contract Manager, you’ll be part of a team of six colleagues. You’ll take ownership of a portfolio of vendors and internal services, driving vendor governance, contract management, and financial steering throughout the full lifecycle—from onboarding to termination. You’ll work independently with your portfolio of vendors and services, but always with a “one team” mindset, supporting each other and continuously improving our ways of working. Expect close collaboration with delivery teams, legal and procurement experts, financial controllers, and external technology vendors.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
* Define and communicate your portfolio of services in collaboration with delivery teams.
* Set and manage budgets, including internal pricing and chargeback models.
* Own vendor relationships and contracts, including vendor governance, contract and software license management.
* Lead procurement and contract negotiations, supported by legal and procurement experts.
* Ensure compliance with third party regulatory frameworks (e.g. DORA, EBA Outsourcing) and internal guidelines.
* Conduct market analysis and contribute to continuous improvement initiatives


**Who You Are**
* You bring positive energy, a proactive mindset, and a passion for getting things done.
* Proven experience in technology vendor and contract management, ideally within infrastructure or security services.
* Strong knowledge of third-party regulations in the financial sector (e.g., DORA, EBA Outsourcing) and practical experience applying them.
* Demonstrated skills in budgeting, financial management, and charge-back models for IT services.
* Good general understanding of technology in general and IT infrastructure in particular.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, from technical teams to senior leadership.
* A collaborative, solution-oriented mindset and the ability to drive change.


**Meritorious Qualifications**
* Experience in telecommunications and network services or cybersecurity services.
* Background in designing and selling these services on the supplier side is considered an advantage.


**Ready for your next challenge?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 Since
 **we select candidates continuously** 
 , feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but
 **no later than** 
**30th January 2026** 
 . If you have questions about the position, please contact Andreas Hallbygård Team Manager via andreas.hallbygard@seb.se, but we will not process applications via email.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and history of crime. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Service Desk Analyst
description:
About the job
 



  





**About TECEZE** 




 TECEZE is an IT services and solutions provider specialising in secure, scalable and resilient technology operations. We design, deploy and manage
 **infrastructure and digital workplace solutions** 
 for customers worldwide, helping them modernise networks, datacentres and end-user environments.
 



  





**Job Overview** 




 We are looking for a motivated and customer-focused
 **L1 Service Desk / IT Support Engineer** 
 to join our IT support team. The ideal candidate will provide first-level technical assistance to end users, troubleshoot common IT issues, and ensure timely resolution of incidents while maintaining a high level of customer satisfaction. Fluency in
 **both Swedish and English** 
 is mandatory for this role.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Provide
 **first-level technical support** 
 to users via phone, email, chat, and ticketing systems
* Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to:



 -Desktop/laptop hardware
 



 -Windows operating systems
 



 -MS Office and standard business applications
 



 -Basic network connectivity (LAN, Wi-Fi, VPN)
 


* Log, track, and manage incidents and service requests while adhering to defined
 **SLAs**
* Perform
 **basic user account administration** 
 , including:



 -Active Directory user management
 



 -Password resets and account unlocks
 



 -Access and permission-related issues
 


* Escalate unresolved or complex issues to
 **L2/L3 support teams** 
 with clear and accurate documentation
* Maintain detailed and up-to-date ticket notes, troubleshooting steps, and resolution details
* Follow
 **ITIL best practices** 
 for incident, problem, and request management
* Deliver a professional and positive
 **customer support experience** 
 at all times
* Participate in shift rotations and provide support during required business hours.



  





**Required Skills & Qualifications** 



* Minimum
 **1 year of experience** 
 in an L1 Service Desk, Help Desk, or similar IT support role
* **Fluency in Swedish and English** 
 (both written and verbal) – mandatory
* Strong working knowledge of:



 -Windows OS
 



 -MS Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, Teams)
 



 -Basic hardware and software troubleshooting
 


* Familiarity with
 **ticketing tools** 
 (ServiceNow, Jira, Remedy, or similar)
* Basic understanding of
 **ITIL processes**
* Strong communication, customer-handling, and interpersonal skills
* Good analytical and problem-solving abilities
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment
* Willingness to work in
 **shifts** 
 , including rotational or extended hours if required



  





**Preferred / Nice to Have** 



* ITIL Foundation certification
* Experience supporting enterprise IT environments
* Exposure to Office 365, VPN, and remote support tools
* Prior experience in a multilingual support environment



  





**Why Join Us** 



* Opportunity to work in a dynamic and global IT support environment
* Gain hands-on experience with enterprise systems and processes
* Collaborative team culture with learning and growth opportunities

title: Business Analyst - Reverse Supply
description:
**Job Description**

**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
  

 We are looking for a curious and self-driven Business Analyst to join our Supply Planning Unit. In this role, you will lead analytics initiatives and maintain and develop systems for all three Reverse Supply areas (External Exit and overstock selling, faulty items and garment collection). You’ll play a key part in the team in helping unwanted garments get a new life, and ensure the garments end up in the right place! As a proactive self-starter, you will take ownership of projects from hypothesis to insight and delivery, thrive on ambiguity, ask the right questions, and challenge the status quo.  This position requires a blend of business acumen and analytical skills.
   

  





 Your key responsibilities include:
   

  




* Lead analytics initiatives from hypothesis to delivery, turning data into actionable insights.


* Own and develop internal applications supporting overstock sales and partner management.


* Use SQL and Power BI to gather, clean, and visualize data.


* Develop and maintain web-based applications.


* Maintain and follow-up on sustainability KPIs for business development and public disclosure.


* Act as the go-to person for data and application-related questions and incidents


* Drive automation and data validation in areas with manual processes.


* Collaborate cross-functionally within Supply Planning and across H&M Group.



**WHO YOU ARE**
  

 Just like everyone at H&M, we believe you are a business-minded, open, communicative, and ambitious team player full of drive and optimism. You have a robust analytical ability, business acumen, self-drive with an eye for change and improvement opportunities.
   

  





*We are looking for people with ...*



* Years of experience in a data-driven role within supply chain operations, ideally in overstock handling, returns management, or circular fashion initiatives.


* Proven hands-on experience with SQL for querying large datasets, and Power BI for building dashboards and visualizing KPIs.


* Experience with Python or other programming language for automation, C# for application logic, and JavaScript for web-application development is a bonus.


* Experience with Power Automate for workflow optimization is a strong plus.


* Exposure to Cloud Platforms and maintaining web-based applications, especially in the context of internal business applications and data pipelines, is beneficial.



*And people who are...*



* Strong communicators and storytellers with the skills and ability to communicate and explain data and its implications to various different stakeholders.


* Curious and take the initiative, driven to explore new ideas, ask questions, and take ownership from start to finish


* Based in Stockholm and able to commute to the office 4 days/week (no relocation support).



**Please Note!** 
 This is a temporary position that will run from as soon as possible until January 2027.
   

  





  

  





**WHO WE ARE** 
**​**




 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.​
   

  





 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. ​
   

  





 ​
   

  





**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE** 
**​**
  

 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. ​
   

  




* We offer all our employee’s attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a 25% staff discount usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
* ​30 days holiday
* Collective agreement which includes pension and life insurance
* Wellness benefit 4000kr/year
* Beniflex Benefits Portal
* Community with activities



  

  





**JOIN US** 
**​**




 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.​
   

  





 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.​
   

  





*\** 
*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.* 
 ​

title: Application Engineer
description:
**About Kambi**
*Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.*
*Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.*
 Kambi is a B2B provider of premium sports betting services seeking an Application Engineer to join its Engineering Operations team, focusing on deployment pipeline management, continuous delivery, and collaboration with development teams to ensure scalable system delivery on cloud and on-premise infrastructure. The role requires proficiency in Python, scripting, and technologies like Linux, automation, cloud computing (preferably AWS), and container architecture, offering a flexible, international work environment with agile methodologies and opportunities for professional growth.
   

  

**This is what our Application Engineers do:**
* Manage and support operation supporting systems and functions
* Build and maintain the continuous delivery platform so we can deploy frequently and reliably to multiple sites across the globe


**You'll like Kambi if you:**
* Have high expectations of yourself and your peers
* Enjoy working in a self-organizing, self-managing team
* Comfortable to work in a production environment
* Think common sense goes a long way


**You'd like to work with these technologies:**
* Linux Debian
* Configuration Management
* Automation
* Message queue, Event Streaming and Repository
* Orchestration
* Cloud Computing preferably AWS
* Container architecture


**We expect you to:**
* Be a team player
* Be fluent in Python and scripting.
* Have the mindset and skills to become an effective part of a cross-function, self-organizing, self-managing team


**What’s in it for you?**
* Opportunity to work in a successful and fast-growing company
* A (fun and) flexible working culture
* Ability to directly influence your and your teams’ work environment and processes
* Work with very smart and humble people
* Management who understands and appreciates agile
* International work environment


 If you want to be part of a very dedicated community of dev-ops practitioners in central Stockholm. Please apply below.
   

  

 #wearekambi
   

  

***Kambi's ongoing commitment to Diversity and Inclusion in the workplace***
*If you require any reasonable adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify your recruiter, who will assist you however they can. Diversity and inclusion is at the heart of who we are and who we aim to be. While we are proud of the positive and inclusive company culture we have created, we know we can do so much more. Kambi constantly evolves its Diversity and Inclusion strategy to ensure it becomes an even more inclusive and positive place to work, with the core management team reaffirming its commitment to delivering on employee feedback.*
***Creating an inclusive environment***
*We believe Kambi's greatest strength is the collective talent of our employees. Kambi is committed to ensuring we create an inclusive work environment where everyone can feel valued, thrive and achieve their potential, regardless of who they are or what their background is. We know that it is only by having a balance of different voices, values and opinions that Kambi is able to be the market leader it is today.*
*#wearekambi*

title: CTO Stockholm
description:
**OTAKOYI is looking for an experienced and proactive CTO to oversee multi-functional development teams on a client project.** 




 The product is a subscription-based SaaS platform designed to centralize and streamline Payroll, HR, Accounting, and a range of administrative services for SMEs. The MVP has been built and is currently preparing for delivery to our first client. The roadmap includes five major development iterations that will significantly expand functionality, performance, and integrations. As the platform moves away from the current external vendor, we are building an in-house tech team and seeking a CTO to lead the technical vision, architecture, and execution.
 



  





 We are looking for an experienced, hands-on
 **Chief Technology Officer (CTO)** 
 to take full ownership of the product’s technology direction as it enters its next stage of growth. This is a unique opportunity to join at a pivotal moment—right when the product is transitioning from MVP to market-ready solution. The CTO will lead the migration from the existing vendor, build and mentor an internal engineering team, and drive all upcoming development iterations. 
 



 You will be responsible for ensuring product scalability, reliability, security (including compliance with Swedish and EU requirements), and long-term technical excellence.We are looking for an experienced, hands-on Chief Technology Officer (CTO) to take full ownership of the product’s technology direction as it enters its next stage of growth. This is a unique opportunity to join at a pivotal moment—right when the product is transitioning from MVP to market-ready solution. The CTO will lead the migration from the existing vendor, build and mentor an internal engineering team, and drive all upcoming development iterations. You will be responsible for ensuring product scalability, reliability, security (including compliance with Swedish and EU requirements), and long-term technical excellence.
   




**Skills & Qualifications** 
* **Technical Leadership & Strategy** 
 Define and own the long-term technology roadmap, architecture, and infrastructure vision.
* Lead the evolution of the MVP into a scalable, secure, market-ready platform.
* Ensure the product is built to support future growth, integrations, and multi-client onboarding.
* **Team Building & Management** 
 Assemble and manage an remote development team (backend, frontend, QA, DevOps, Design).
* Establish engineering processes, best practices, and a strong development culture.
* Mentor and grow the team through the next 5 major product iterations.
* **Product Development & Delivery** 
 Oversee the completion and release of the product to the first client.
* Manage the transition from the current vendor to internal development ownership.
* Drive iteration cycles, ensuring timely and high-quality releases.
* Collaborate closely with Product, Operations, and Business stakeholders to translate requirements into technical solutions.
* **Quality, Security & Compliance** 
 Ensure compliance with relevant Swedish/EU regulations (GDPR, payroll and accounting standards, data protection).
* Implement strong DevOps practices, CI/CD, cloud infrastructure, and monitoring.
* **Budgeting & Vendor Management** 
 Guarantee product reliability, performance, and security from day one.
* Manage the technical budget and resource planning.
* Oversee contractors or external partners during the transitional periode.
* Optimize infrastructure costs without compromising performance or security.


**﻿
 
 Responsibilities** 
* Must-Have Experience: Proven CTO, Head of Engineering, or Senior Engineering Lead experience in a SaaS or HR/Payroll/FinTech/Accounting-related product is a plus
* Strong background in delivering and scaling cloud-based applications.
* Deep architectural and hands-on expertise (tech stack details customized on request).
* Experience building engineering teams from scratch.
* Strong understanding of data security, compliance, and scalable systems.
* Experience in Sweden or EU market is a strong advantage.
* Familiarity with NodeJS, ReactJS, Azure, AWS tech stacks
* Soft-Skills
* Strategic thinker with a practical, execution-focused mindset.
* Strong leadership and communication skills.
* Ability to lead through early-stage product uncertainty.
* Comfortable working directly with early clients and business stakeholders.
* 10+ years of experience with Engineering Management.
* Proficiency in back end programming languages (Java, etc.).
* Strong familiarity with Azure Services and Azure Foundre Strong familiarity CI/CD tools.
* Proven ability to work both collaboratively and independently.
* Strong initiative and decision-making abilities.
* English proficiency at Upper-Intermediate or higher (spoken and written).
* Strong experience with at least one modern frontend framework (React, Angular, or Vue.js).
* Experience with ReactJS will be a plus (ReactJS, NextJS, TailwindCSS, SSR/SPA).
* Knowledge of frontend testing frameworks and experience with end-to-end testing.
* Experience in setting up build systems and managing frontend performance.
* Familiarity with GenAI workflows, NLP and/or Computer Vision Ability to interpret model results and communicate insights clearly.
* Knowledge of data processing tools like Apache Spark, Kafka, or similar is a plus.
* Strong project management skills, with a proven record of leading diverse technical teams.
* Excellent communication skills to interface with both technical teams and non-technical stakeholders.
* High level of adaptability, capable of balancing hands-on technical contributions with strategic planning.
* Ability to motivate, mentor, and cultivate a collaborative and high-performing team environment.

title: IT&OT-chef till SFAB
description:
**Vill du bli vår nya IT&OT-chef och vara med på en spännande utvecklingsresa? Har du ett starkt intresse för ledarskap, IT och OT? Då är du rätt person för oss! Välkommen med din ansökan** 




  





 SFAB spelar en nyckelroll i den cirkulära ekonomin genom att erbjuda klimatsmarta och pålitliga energilösningar som främjar hållbar samhällsutveckling. Vi är den naturliga energipartnern i Huddinge, Botkyrka och Salems kommuner – en av Sveriges mest expansiva regioner. När Huddinge, Botkyrka och Salem växer behövs energisystem som kan möta det växande behovet av värme och kyla. Det är sådana system vi skapar. Med våra resurssmarta lösningar möter vi det växande behovet av värme och kyla i både bostäder och på arbetsplatser, alltid med omtanke om kunden, klimatet och samhället.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som IT&OT-chef blir du en del av en resa där vi satsar på digitalisering, AI och cybersäkerhet. Rollen innebär ansvar för den strategiska utvecklingen av IT&OT-miljön, förvaltning av våra verksamhetssystem och att skapa tekniska förutsättningar för att ta nästa steg i vår digitala utveckling. Du har det yttersta ansvaret för vår IT&OT-avdelning och rapporterar direkt till vd.
 



 Du leder ett team på fyra personer, driver det dagliga arbetet och coachar medarbetarna framåt. I rollen ingår även nära samarbete med verksamheten i olika projekt samt många kontaktytor både internt och externt.
 



 Då rollen är bred och utmanande ser vi att du tycker om att arbeta med varierande arbetsuppgifter, både operativt och strategiskt, samt har ett flexibelt tänk som passar i en föränderlig miljö och en expanderande verksamhet.
 



  





**Du kommer i din roll som IT-chef att:** 








* Ansvara för strategisk utveckling av IT&OT-miljö samt teknisk informations- och cybersäkerhet
* Äga och utveckla IT&OT:s projektportfölj
* Skapa tekniska förutsättningar för AI och digitalisering samt hålla ihop den strategiska förvaltningen av våra verksamhetssystem
* Ansvara för budget och leverantörsstyrning
* Ha personalansvar för avdelningens medarbetare
* Bevaka teknikutvecklingen inom fjärrvärmebranschen
* Ingå i SFAB:s ledningsgrupp och vara delaktig i affärsplanearbetet



  





**För att trivas och prestera i rollen ser vi att du har:** 



* Relevant akademisk utbildning eller motsvarande erfarenhet
* Flerårig chefserfarenhet med personalansvar och erfarenhet av att arbeta i ledningsgrupp
* Bred kompetens inom IT&OT-området och trivs i en varierad ledarroll
* Erfarenhet av OT, SCADA-system och teknisk datainsamling
* Erfarenhet av att leda en beställarorganisation i en outsourcad IT&OT-driftmiljö
* Kunskap om ITIL samt informations- och cybersäkerhet
* Förmåga att se helheten i en verksamhet och förstå samband mellan olika processer och system
* Vana av och gillar att samarbeta med leverantörer och andra intressenter
* Vilja och drivkraft att skapa framgång i en miljö med högt resultat- och kundfokus



 Du uttrycker dig väl på svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift.
 



  





 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet från energisektorn, infrastruktur eller processindustri, alternativt en annan samhällskritisk verksamhet.
 



  





 Som person är du tydlig i ditt ledarskap, engagerad och kommunikativ. Du gillar att driva förändringar och förbättringar, är serviceinriktad och har ett strategiskt förhållningssätt. Du tar initiativ och gillar varierande arbetsuppgifter. Vidare är du analytisk, ansvarstagande och prestigelös. Vi tror att du ständigt vill lära dig nya saker och utforska teknikens möjligheter.
 



  





**Vi erbjuder:** 
 Här får du vara med och forma framtidens smarta energisamhälle. Du får ett spännande arbete i en organisation där miljö och utveckling står i fokus. Vi erbjuder flera olika förmåner t ex gym på arbetsplatsen, arbetstidsförkortning, attraktivt friskvårdsbidrag, lunchförmån, regelbundna hälsokontroller samt ett förmånligt pensionsavtal och en aktiv personalklubb. Vi vet att våra medarbetare är nyckeln till framgång och nöjda kunder, därför arbetar vi medvetet för att vara en stimulerande och ansvarstagande arbetsplats, där kompetensutveckling och balans i livet är viktiga delar. Mångfald och jämställdhet hjälper oss att utvecklas och vi arbetar aktivt med hälsa och friskvård. Läs gärna mer på https://rekrytering.sfab.se/
 



  





**Kontakt och ansökan:** 
 SFAB arbetar inom samhällskritisk verksamhet och rekryteringsprocessen innehåller bakgrundskontroll och säkerhetsintervju.
 



 Kontakta gärna Carina Eyoma på 073-086 22 75 alt carina.eyoma@se.experis.com. Vi arbetar med löpande urval så skicka in din ansökan omgående.

title: IT-Säkerhetsarkitekt
description:
Bakgrund
   


 Som IT-säkerhetsarkitekt på Alecta har du en nyckelroll i att säkerställa att IT-infrastruktur och system uppfyller höga krav på säkerhet och efterlevande. Du ingår i informationssäkerhetsfunktionen och arbetar nära IT-säkerhetsansvarig, specialister, IT-arkitekter, produktägare och leverantörer med att se till att rätt säkerhetsförmågor implementeras på rätt ställe.
 


  

 Arbetsuppgifter
   


 I arbetsuppgifterna ingår att:
 


  

  
* Definiera, utveckla och förvalta Alectas övergripande IT-säkerhetsarkitektur baserat på verksamhetens krav och förväntningar.
  
* Delta i omvärlds-, hotbilds- och riskanalyser.
  
* Stödja specialister och team i arbetet med val, design och implementation av IT-säkerhetslösningar i olika plattformar, system och applikationer.
  
* Informera och bygga kunskap om styrande principer, förmågor och riktlinjer för IT-säkerhetsarkitektur, samt stödja att den implementeras och efterlevs.
  


  

 Specifik kompetens
   


 Du har:
 


  

  
* Bred och djup teknisk kunskap inom IT-säkerhet och IT-infrastruktur.
  
* Erfarenhet av IT-säkerhetsarkitektur och lösningsdesign.
  
* Erfarenhet av säkerhetsgranskningar och penetrationstester.
  
* Breda kunskaper inom IT-infrastruktur, till exempel Windows, AD, Azure, M365, Mainframe och DevSecOps.
  


  

 Personliga egenskaper
   


 Rollen som IT-säkerhetsarkitekt förutsätter att du har ett intresse av att hantera komplexa utmaningar, tar initiativ och gillar att tillsammans med andra hitta effektiva lösningar på uppsatta mål. Du har:
 


  

  
* Förmåga att ta in och strukturera stora mängder information.
  
* Ett systematiskt och analytiskt arbetssätt.
  
* En god förmåga att ta initiativ och självständigt planera och prioritera arbetet.
  
* God samarbetsförmåga och förmåga att på ett pedagogiskt sätt kommunicera både med verksamhet, tekniska specialister och leverantörer.
  


  

 Din bakgrund
   


 Du har:
 


  

  
* Relevant högskoleexamen eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet.
  
* Gedigen erfarenhet av IT-säkerhet i miljöer med höga krav på säkerhet och efterlevnad.
  
* Gedigen erfarenhet av att arbeta i en roll som IT-säkerhetsarkitekt eller motsvarande.
  


  


 Följande kunskaper och erfarenheter är meriterande:
 


  

  
* Erfarenhet och kunskap om föreskrifter och standarder inom informations- och IT-säkerhet, till exempel ISO 27000, DORA, NIS2, GDPR och NIST.
  
* Relevanta certifieringar.
  
* Erfarenhet av projektledning, riskhantering, sårbarhetshantering, kontinuitetsplanering och kravställning mot leverantörer.
  
* Erfarenhet av arbete i bank- eller försäkringsbolag.
  


  


  
 


  


**Information och ansökan** 



  


 Vill du vara med och bygga framtidens Informationssäkerhet i en CISO-organisation med långsiktighet, trygghet och samhällsnytta i fokus? Skicka in din ansökan idag!
 


  


 För mer information om tjänsten är du välkommen att mejla Linda Avad, CISO, linda.avad@alecta.se alternativt ringa Carina Johansson HR, telefon 08-441 66 17. Vi intervjuar löpande så skicka in din ansökan snarast,
 **dock senast den 23 januari 2026.** 



  


  
 


  

 Om Alecta
   


 Alecta är förvaltare av tjänstepension sedan 1917. Vårt uppdrag är att ge kollektivavtalade tjänstepensioner så stort värde som möjligt för både våra företags- och privatkunder. Det gör vi genom god avkastning, bra kundservice och låga kostnader. Vi förvaltar mer än 1300 miljarder kronor åt våra ägare som är 2,8 miljoner privatkunder och 37 000 företagskunder
 


  


 Alecta månar om ditt välbefinnande och din livsbalans. Vi erbjuder dig ett generöst friskvårdsbidrag, lunchbidrag, tillgång till motionssal, extra lediga dagar och mycket mer. Vänlighet och hjälpsamhet präglar vår företagskultur, välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Solutions Architect
description:
Lead Data Engineer / Solutions Architect
 



**Stockholm (Hybrid)** 




  





**Permanent | Senior Level | Product & Consulting Hybrid** 




*Build the data foundations that make AI actually work* 




  





 Everyone talks about AI.
 



 Few organisations have the data foundations to support it.
 



  





 We’re a Stockholm-based product company operating at the intersection of data platforms, analytics, and modern consultancy. Our mission is simple but ambitious: make advanced analytics and AI achievable, sustainable, and efficient - without the endless manual work that slows most data initiatives down.
 



  





 We’re now looking for a
 **Lead Data Engineer / Solutions Architect** 
 to help us scale both our product and our customer impact.
 



  





 This is a role for someone who wants real technical ownership, enjoys working close to customers, and believes that great architecture beats brute-force delivery.
 



  





 Why this role exists?
 



 We’re growing quickly. Our platform is in production with customers, our consultants are fully booked, and demand is increasing.
 



  





 By bringing in a senior lead, you will:
 


* Step directly into active projects
* Take architectural ownership alongside founders and senior engineers
* Free up time for deeper product innovation
* Help shape how we scale - technically and culturally



  





 This is not a “keep-the-lights-on” role.
 



  





 It’s about building the foundation others depend on.
 



  





 What you’ll work on:
 



 End-to-end data architecture
 



 You’ll design and implement modern, cloud-native data platforms that support:
 


* Business intelligence
* Advanced analytics
* Machine learning and AI use cases



  





 Your solutions must be robust, semantic, and machine-readable - not just visually appealing dashboards.
 



  





 AI-ready data foundations
 



 You’ll apply proven modelling approaches (Kimball, Inmon, Data Vault) and modern architectural patterns (e.g. medallion layers) to ensure:
 


* High data quality
* Strong governance
* Long-term adaptability



  





 Because “garbage in” doesn’t just mean bad reports - it means unreliable AI.
 



  





 Automation first
 



 We believe manual work is a design failure.
 



 You’ll build pipelines and orchestration with automation as the default:
 


* Minimal manual intervention
* High observability
* Reliable, repeatable deployments



  





 Technical leadership
 



 You’ll:
 


* Set standards for architecture, quality, and documentation
* Mentor less experienced engineers
* Act as a bridge between business needs and technical execution



  





 Advisory and trust
 



 You’ll work closely with customers, helping them move from legacy setups to modern platforms - not by selling hours, but by making them faster and more independent.
 



  





 The environment you’ll join
 


* A product company, not a body-shop
* A small, senior, highly collaborative team
* Flat structure, low ego, high trust
* Decisions made close to the code
* Long-term thinking over short-term billing



  





 We combine product development with consulting partnerships because we believe the fastest way to improve analytics is to build better tools - not to maximise hours spent.
 



 This also means you’ll see your ideas:
 


* Shipped
* Used
* Iterated on
* And improved based on real customer feedback



  





 Tech & experience
 



 We care more about capability and judgement than ticking every box, but you’ll likely have:
 



  





 Experience
 


* 5+ years in data engineering, analytics engineering, or data architecture
* Experience designing solutions end-to-end, not just building parts of them



  





 Strong foundations in
 


* Advanced SQL (T-SQL / PL-SQL, optimisation, performance)
* Cloud platforms (Azure preferred, but AWS / Snowflake experience is equally valued)
* Modern BI tools (Power BI, Qlik, Tableau)
* Data warehouse automation and modern architecture patterns



  





 Mindset
 


* You take pride in enabling others through solid foundations
* You care deeply about data quality, lineage, and governance
* You enjoy learning - whether that’s new cloud services, AI integrations, or better architectural patterns
* You prefer elegant systems over quick fixes



  





 Ways of working
 


* Hybrid setup - Stockholm-based, flexible office presence
* Swedish work culture: trust, balance, autonomy, and responsibility
* Six weeks of vacation
* Flexible compensation model (fixed salary available if preferred)
* Guaranteed paid baseline even between assignments
* Opportunity for ownership/shares for long-term engagement



  





 Fluent Swedish is strongly preferred due to customer interaction, but exceptional candidates may be considered even if Swedish isn’t yet perfect.
 



  





 Who thrives here?
 



 This role is ideal if you:
 


* Are tired of over-engineered bureaucracy or under-engineered shortcuts
* Want to influence both product direction and customer outcomes
* Enjoy working in a Nordic, collaborative environment where people help each other
* Want stability
 *and* 
 the energy of a scale-up



  





 Build foundations. Enable intelligence. Ship things that matter.
 



  





 If you believe great AI starts with great data - and that great data starts with thoughtful architecture - this could be the most rewarding role you’ve had in years.

title: Tekniker
description:
**Om Carla**
 Vi på Carla vill sätta en ny standard för hur man köper bil. Vårt mål är att det ska vara lika lätt och tryggt att köpa eller leasa en bil online, som allt annat man köper på nätet. Självklart ska alla bilar vara laddbara. Bolaget grundades 2020 i Stockholm och är nu i en spännande tillväxtfas och letar därför efter en nya härlig kollegor till vår anläggning i Kungsängen.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 En tekniker eller mekaniker utför reparationer, service och felsökning av lätta fordon. Dessutom kräver dagens bilar att du är proffs på elektronik och felsökning. Arbetet kräver kunskap inom mekanik, elektronik och IT. Moderna fordon består av ett stort antal ihopkopplade datorer, därför måste fordonsmekaniker vara datorsmarta. Kundkontakter blir allt vanligare vilket ställer krav på social kompetens. Inom Carla finns goda utvecklingsmöjligheter för dig som tekniker.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
* Service
* Reparationer
* Felsökning
* Däckbyte
* Demontering och montering av karossdelar inför och efter lackeringsarbete


**Meriterande egenskaper:**
 Fordonselektronik
   

  

 Felsöknings-/reparationsvana
   

  

 Fordonsteknik
   

  

 Fordonstillbehör
   

  

 Mekaniska reparationsarbeten
   

  

 Felsökning
   

  

**Omfattning**
 Heltid, provanställning 6 månader
   

  

**Vi söker dig som:**
* Har 2-3 års erfarenhet som fordonsmekaniker
* B-körkort
* Är flexibel i ditt arbetssätt och gillar att lära dig och bli bra på nya saker
* Gillar ordning och reda och arbetar strukturera
* Är en god kommunikatör och enkelt driver en tydlig dialog både i tal och skrift med ditt team och andra kollegor
* Gärna har någon erfarenhet av att arbeta med bilar eller ett intresse av det


 Ort: Stockholm, Kungsängen.
   

  

**Vad har vi att erbjuda dig?**
 Först och främst, så erbjuder vi en fantastisk möjlighet att ansluta till ett bolag som bygger en ny onlinemarknad, med starka värderingar, och en affärsmodell som ska vara hållbar på alla sätt. Utöver det så erbjuder vi:
   

  

* En möjlighet att skapa din egen väg på ett relativt nystartat bolag, men med möjligheten att växa och lära från duktiga, och trevliga medarbetare
* Möjligheten att jobba smartare, snarare än mer. Att få en balans i livet är en viktig del i att skapa resultat över en längre tid
* En arbetsplats som på riktigt tror på mångfald. Vi har anställt, och fortsätter anställa helt oberoende av etnisk bakgrund, utbildning, erfarenhet, sexuell läggning, och allt annat som borde vara självklart 2024
* Konkurrenskraftig och marknadsmässig ersättning


**Nu när du kommit såhär långt...**
* så kanske just du är vår nya kollega? Se då till att ansök idag! Urval och rekryteringsprocess sker löpande, så sök så snart du kan!

title: Enterprise Architect
description:
**About Justera Group**
 Justera Group AB is a leading Swedish IT consulting firm with great experience specializing in building high-performing technology teams and delivering end-to-end IT solutions. Led by dynamic female executives, Justera Group focuses on helping businesses harness the power of digital technologies to continuously evolve in today’s rapidly changing economy. The company has deep expertise in IT consultancy, software development, and recruitment services, providing clients with purpose-driven, well-trained consultants who consistently deliver efficient and effective results. Justera Group manages the entire talent lifecycle, from hiring to ongoing management, ensuring the right fit for each project on time and within budget. With their strong commitment to quality, collaboration, and client success, Justera Group is a trusted partner for technology innovation across Sweden.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 We are looking for an experienced Enterprise Architect to strengthen architecture governance and coordination within a large public organization. The role focuses on defining clear mandates, responsibilities, and working methods for both IT and business architecture, ensuring efficient decision-making and effective governance across the organization. The assignment includes reviewing and updating governing documents, clarifying coordination between architecture governance and product areas, and supporting implementation of organizational improvements.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Develop and propose frameworks for architecture governance, with IT having overall responsibility
* Establish and anchor common working methods, governance structures, and collaboration models
* Revise, optimize, and maintain governing and supporting architecture documents
* Clarify and strengthen coordination between architecture governance and product areas
* Lead and coordinate activities across teams when needed
* Analyze complex issues and communicate solutions clearly and effectively


**Requirements:**
* At least 7 years of experience in overall architecture management in large organizations (≥1000 employees) within the last 10 years
* Current experience in architecture management and agile practices in a public authority or large organization
* Proven experience with overall responsibility for architecture
* Minimum 2 years of current experience in architecture work spanning both IT and operations
* Fluent in Swedish, both spoken and written
* Strong analytical, strategic thinking, and communication skills
* Experience with TOGAF and SAFe frameworks
* Experience leading IT specialists
* Experience in project and change management
* Assignment performed on-site with hybrid flexibility located in Örebro or Norrköping
* May require signing a security agreement if classification changes


**What We Offer:**
* A dynamic and innovative workplace driving advancements in cutting-edge robotic technologies
* The opportunity to collaborate with talented cross-functional teams on meaningful and impactful projects
* Competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package
* A supportive culture that fosters continuous learning, growth, and professional development
* Flexible hybrid working model for an optimal work-life balance
* 25 days of annual leave to recharge and relax
* An annual wellness allowance of 3,500 SEK to support your health and wellbeing

title: IT-SPECIALIST INOM WINDOWS SERVER OCH EXCHANGE
description:
**Vill du ha ett meningsfullt arbete och bidra till ett säkrare Sverige i en osäker värld?**
 Det förändrade omvärldsläget medför att vårt försvar behöver förstärkas och den ökade underrättelseverksamheten mot Sverige och Försvarsmakten är omfattande. Militära underrättelse- och säkerhetstjänsten (Must) bedriver försvarsunderrättelseverksamhet och militär underrättelse- och säkerhetstjänst till stöd för svensk utrikes-, försvars- och säkerhetspolitik samt i övrigt för kartläggning av yttre hot mot Sverige.
   

  

**Vårt erbjudande**
 Vi erbjuder ett viktigt och stimulerande arbete där du dagligen bidrar till Sveriges säkerhet. Vi erbjuder också mycket goda möjligheter till kompetensutveckling. Hos oss finns det friskvårdsmöjligheter som inkluderar träning tre timmar i veckan på arbetstid samt möjlighet att ha balans mellan fritid och arbete.
   

  

**Om enheten**
 Vi söker nu en IT-specialist inom Windows Server och Exchange till Musts Kontor för informationsteknologi (KIT). KIT ansvarar för informationshantering på Must-gemensam nivå samt planering, utveckling och vidmakthållande av IT-system. Kontoret arbetar för att stärka Musts flexibilitet och förmåga att svara upp mot verksamhetskrav på informationshantering och informationssystem.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
 Som IT-specialist inom Windows Server och Exchange kommer du arbeta med utveckling, implementering och förvaltning av Microsoftprodukter med höga krav på säkerhet. I arbetsuppgifterna ingår även framtagande och utveckling av rutiner och arbetssätt.
   

  

 Vanligt förekommande löpande arbetsuppgifter är att utföra tekniskt underhåll, hantera uppdateringar, felsökning och driftstöd. Vid införande av nya lösningar kommer du, tillsammans med kollegor, arbeta med planering, design, dokumentation, rutiner och konfiguration.
   

  

 Arbetet är omväxlande och för att lyckas i din roll ser vi att du trivs med att samarbeta. Här blir du en del av ett team med lagspelare som bryr sig om varandra, agerar med högt säkerhetstänk och som hjälper varandra till framgång!
   

  

 Beredskapstjänstgöring och resor kan förekomma.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 Vi ställer som krav att du uppfyller följande kriterier:
   

  

* Mycket god kunskap och flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet av systemadministration inom Windows server
* Flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet och god förståelse om IT-infrastruktur i större organisation
* Arbetslivserfarenhet och god kunskap om Exchange
* God kunskap och förståelse för IT-säkerhet
* God förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska


**Meriterande**
 Det är meriterande om du uppfyller några av dessa kriterier:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av att införa eller migrera e-postlösningar
* Erfarenhet och kunskap inom virtualisering
* Erfarenhet från Försvarsmakten eller annan organisation med höga krav på säkerhet
* Relevant akademisk utbildning eller motsvarande erfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer som likvärdig


**Personliga egenskaper**
 Våra medarbetare har olika bakgrund men med ett gemensamt intresse och kunskap inom IT. För att vara framgångsrik i rollen ser vi gärna att du uppskattar att både självständigt och i samarbete med andra, anta utmaningar och förmedla lösningar. Detta innebär god förmåga att både sätta dig in i olika verksamheter och tekniska lösningar. Det är också viktigt att du är flexibel för att kunna hantera förändrade förutsättningar och nya tekniker. Som person är du trygg i dig själv, har stor integritet och är naturligt säkerhetsmedveten. Du är en nyfiken och kreativ person som tar ett stort ansvar för dina åtaganden. För att lyckas i rollen är du en strukturerad, uppsökande och självgående person. Stor vikt kommer att läggas vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Urval kommer att ske löpande. Tjänsten kräver arbete på plats och det finns därmed inte möjlighet till hemarbete. Ovan ställda kvalifikationer ska på begäran kunna verifieras genom intyg, referenser samt urvalstester.
   

  

 Tjänsten är placerad i Stockholm och är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid som inleds med sex månaders provanställning. Tillträde snarast enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

**För upplysningar om befattningen eller rekryteringsprocessen kontakta:**
 hkv-rekrytering-must@mil.se, vänligen ange ”IT-specialist Windows Server och Exchange” i ämnesraden.
   

  

**Fackliga företrädare**
 Fackliga representanter nås via hkv-rekrytering-must@mil.se.
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdag**
 Välkommen med din ansökan senast 2026-02-13. Din ansökan ska innehålla CV och ett personligt brev. Urval sker löpande. I det personliga brevet vill vi att du motiverar varför du är lämpad för en befattning hos oss.
   

  

 ,
 **Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via Försvarsmaktens webbplats.** 
 -------------------------------------------------------- Militära underrättelse- och säkerhetstjänsten (Must) är en del av Försvarsmaktens högkvarter i Stockholm. Vi ger regeringen och Försvarsmakten kvalificerade beslutsunderlag om omvärldsutvecklingen och hot mot Sveriges och Försvarsmaktens säkerhet. Vår vision är ”Ett säkrare Sverige i en osäker värld”. Must är en kunskapsorganisation och erbjuder både spännande och för Sverige angelägna arbetsuppgifter. Här arbetar både officerare och civila experter inom olika områden, t ex statsvetenskap, IT, ekonomi, teknik, matematik och HR. En stor del av Must verksamhet omfattas av sekretess och vi ber dig därför att inte berätta att du sökt jobb hos Must för andra personer än dina närmaste. Läs gärna mer om Must och vår verksamhet här Varje dag och varje timme gör våra medarbetare insatser som påverkar andra människors liv, både i stort och smått, och både på hemmaplan och runt om i världen. Försvarsmakten ger dig möjlighet att utvecklas som människa och växa i din professionella roll. Vi är en ansvarstagande arbetsgivare och har en öppen organisation där vi ställer upp för varandra. I Försvarsmakten finns en stark värdegrund som bygger på öppenhet, resultat och ansvar. Professionell utveckling och personlig hälsa värdesätts och uppmuntras. Det finns goda förutsättningar för intern karriärrörlighet, friskvård och bra balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Försvarsmakten tillvaratar de kvaliteter som mångfald och jämn könsfördelning tillför verksamheten. Vi välkomnar därför sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter i våra rekryteringar. En anställning hos oss innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. Vanligtvis krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras före anställning enligt 3 kap i säkerhetsskyddslagen. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. I anställningen ingår även en skyldighet att tjänstgöra utomlands. Innebörden av detta varierar beroende på typ av befattning. Till ansökan om anställning ska CV och personligt brev bifogas. Om du går vidare i anställningsprocessen ska alltid vidimerade kopior av betyg och intyg uppvisas. Samtal från externa rekryteringsföretag och säljare undanbedes.

title: Digital Transformation Portfolio Lead
description:
*Passionate about making ideas a reality? Join our welcoming world of tech and let your ideas soar.*
 Join us in building the future! We’re forming a cutting-edge digital transformation team at the heart of the Surveillance organisation, where you’ll be driving impactful change across processes using AI, automation, and advanced technologies. This is a unique opportunity to shape and lead our process transformation from the ground up, pioneering new ways of working that will push boundaries and unlock business potential.
   

  

 Your role
   

  

 The Digital Transformation Portfolio Lead enables and coordinates business-led digital transformation initiatives across Saab Surveillance, with a focus on operational and enterprise use cases. The role establishes and governs the digital transformation portfolio, including demand intake, prioritization, and portfolio follow-up.
   

  

 By defining operating models, methods, and best practices, the role ensures a structured and scalable approach to digitalization and new ways of working. Acting as an enabler rather than an owner of business value, the role supports cross-functional teams, aligns initiatives with IT governance, and creates transparency around maturity, scalability, and impact across the digital transformation landscape.
   

  

 The role will be part of Surveillance Digital Transformation office, a forward-leaning central team at the COO Office. Working closely with colleagues in our various business units, as well as with experts in AI, Data, Change Management, and other key areas. The role will collaborate with transformation partners (internal and external), end-2-end value analysis teams, and leverage both Saab Business Area IT and Corporate IT digitalization capabilities to advance digitalization opportunities and push our transformation initiatives forward.
   

  

 Your profile
   

  

 The person we are looking for demonstrates strong collaboration and relationship-building skills, combined with high emotional intelligence and the ability to navigate complex stakeholder landscapes. You are structured, systematic, and comfortable working with prioritization, governance, and follow-up. Through clear communication and strong change management capabilities, you engage and align stakeholders across business and tech.
   

  

 Regarding experience and education, we are looking for someone with:
   

  

* A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering, Business, Information Systems, or a related field
* Experience working with digital transformation portfolios, programs, or complex initiatives in an enterprise environment
* A solid understanding of digital technologies and data-driven ways of working (e.g., automation, AI, analytics), without the need to be a deep technical specialist
* Experience in demand management, agile project management, portfolio governance, or cross-functional coordination
* Fluent in both Swedish and English


 It is meritorious if you have:
   

  

* Experience in end-to-end digital transformation delivery, including assessment, design, development, deployment, benefit tracking and scaling of digital solutions
* Experience with security, governance and compliance in digitalization projects, ensuring solutions are secure, compliant, and sustainable
* Experience with innovation- and hypothesis driven models
* Experience leading digital-driven transformation projects, preferably within complex, cross-functional environments (industries like tech, manufacturing, defense, as well as supporting functions such as finance, procurement, project management and quality)
* Understanding of transformation and improvement methodologies (e.g., Lean, Value Stream Mapping, Change Management, Design thinking) and how they integrate with digitalization initiatives


 If you’re passionate about innovation, thrive on solving complex challenges, and want to be part of something new and bold, this is your chance to make a real difference. Come help us lead the future!
   

  

*This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.*
 What you will be part of
   

  

 Explore a wealth of possibilities. Take on challenges, create smart inventions, and grow beyond. This is a place for curious minds, brave pioneers, and everyone in between. Together, we achieve the extraordinary, each bringing our unique perspectives. Your part matters.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 26,100 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
   

  

 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here
   

  

*Kindly observe that this is an ongoing recruitment process and that the position might be filled before the closing date of the advertisement.*

title: AI Developer
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* You have a Master’s or Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, Computer Science, Information Technology or another related fields.
* You have 2-5 years of proven work experience from working with Agentic AI
* You have 5 years of proven work experience as software developer.
* You are fluent in English.
* You have hands-on experience building agentic AI solutions, strong communication and change leadership skills, and the ability to lead cross-functional AI initiatives with a clear focus on measurable business outcomes.


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 19-01-2026
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
